translation: The words of Jeremiah son of Hilkiah, of the priests who were in Anathoth in the land of Benjamin.
to whom the word of the LORD came in the days of Josiah son of Amon, king of Judah, in the thirteenth year of his reign.

And it came to pass in the days of Jehoiakim son of Josiah, king of Judah, until the end of the eleventh year of Zedekiah son of Josiah, king of Judah, until the exile of Jerusalem in the fifth month.
And the word of the LORD came to me, saying:
Before I formed you in the womb I knew you, and before you came forth from the belly I consecrated you; a prophet to the nations I appointed you.
Then I said, “Ah, Lord GOD, behold, I do not know how to speak, for I am but a youth.”
But the LORD said to me, “Do not say, ‘I am a youth,’ for to all to whom I send you, you shall go, and whatever I command you, you shall speak.”
Do not be afraid of them, for I am with you to deliver you, declares the LORD.
Then the LORD stretched out His hand and touched my mouth, and the LORD said to me, Behold, I have put My words in your mouth.
See, I have appointed you this day over the nations and over the kingdoms, to pluck up and to pull down, and to destroy and to overthrow, to build and to plant.
And the word of the LORD came to me, saying, “What do you see, Jeremiah?” And I said, “I see a rod of an almond tree.”
And the LORD said to me, You have seen well, for I am watching over My word to perform it.
And the word of the LORD came to me a second time, saying, What do you see? And I said, I see a boiling pot, and its face is from the north.
And the LORD said to me, From the north the evil shall be unleashed upon all the inhabitants of the land.

For behold, I am calling all the clans of the kingdoms of the north, declares the LORD; and they shall come, and each shall set his throne at the entrance of the gates of Jerusalem, and against all her walls round about, and against all the cities of Judah.
And I will utter my judgments against them for all their evil, in that they have forsaken Me and have burned incense to other gods, and bowed themselves down to the work of their own hands.
But you, gird up your loins, and arise, and speak to them all that I command you; do not be dismayed before them, lest I dismay you before them.

As for Me, behold, I have made you this day a fortified city, and an iron pillar, and bronze walls against all the land, against the kings of Judah, against its princes, against its priests, and against the people of the land.
And they shall fight against you, but they shall not prevail against you; for I am with you, declares the LORD, to deliver you.
And the word of the LORD came to me, saying,

Go and proclaim in the ears of Jerusalem, saying, Thus says the LORD: I remember for you the devotion of your youth, the love of your betrothals, your going after Me in the wilderness, in a land not sown.
Israel is holiness to the LORD, the firstfruits of His increase; all who devour him shall be held guilty, evil shall come upon them, declares the LORD.
Hear the word of the LORD, O house of Jacob, and all the families of the house of Israel.
Thus says the LORD: What iniquity did your fathers find in Me, that they went far from Me, and walked after vanity and became vain?

And they did not say, “Where is the LORD who brought us up out of the land of Egypt, who led us in the wilderness, in a land of desert and pit, in a land of drought and deep darkness, in a land through which no man passed and where no human dwelt?”
And I brought you into a land of fruitfulness, to eat its fruit and its goodness; but you came and defiled My land, and My heritage you made an abomination.

The priests did not say, “Where is the LORD?” and those who handle the law did not know Me; the shepherds transgressed against Me, and the prophets prophesied by Baal and walked after things that do not profit.
Therefore I will yet contend with you, declares the LORD, and with your children’s children will I contend.
For pass over to the coastlands of Kittim and see, and send to Kedar and consider diligently, and see if there has been such a thing as this.
Has a nation changed its gods, though they are no gods? But My people have exchanged their glory for that which does not profit.
Be appalled, O heavens, at this, and shudder, be utterly desolate, declares the LORD.
For my people have committed two evils: they have forsaken Me, the fountain of living waters, to hew out for themselves cisterns, broken cisterns that can hold no water.
Is Israel a servant? Is he a homeborn slave? Why has he become a prey?
Against him young lions roar; they lift up their voice, and they make his land a desolation; his cities are burned, without inhabitant.
Even the sons of Noph and Tahpanhes shall shave the crown of your head.
Is not this done to you, that you have forsaken the LORD your God, when he was leading you in the way?
And now, what have you to do with the way of Egypt, to drink the waters of Shihor? And what have you to do with the way of Assyria, to drink the waters of the River?

Your own evil shall discipline you, and your backslidings shall reprove you; know therefore and see that it is evil and bitter that you have forsaken the LORD your God, and that My fear is not in you, declares the Lord, the LORD of hosts.
For of old I have broken your yoke, I have torn off your bonds, and you said, “I will not serve.” Yet upon every high hill and under every green tree you sprawled, playing the harlot.
Yet I myself had planted you a choice vine, wholly of true seed; how then have you turned before Me into the degenerate branches of a foreign vine?
For though you wash yourself with lye and heap up for yourself much soap, yet your iniquity is marked before Me, declares the Lord GOD.
How can you say, “I am not defiled, I have not gone after the Baals”? Look at your way in the valley, know what you have done— a swift young camel weaving her ways.

A wild donkey accustomed to the wilderness, in the craving of her soul she snuffs up the wind; in her heat, who can turn her back? All who seek her will not grow weary; in her month they will find her.
Restrain your foot from going unshod, and your throat from thirst. But you said, “It is hopeless; no, for I have loved strangers, and after them I will go.”
As the thief is ashamed when he is found, so is the house of Israel put to shame; they, their kings, their princes, and their priests, and their prophets.

Saying to a tree, “You are my father,” and to a stone, “You gave birth to us.” For they have turned to Me the back and not the face; yet in the time of their trouble they will say, “Arise and save us.”
But where are your gods that you made for yourself? Let them arise, if they can save you in the time of your trouble; for as the number of your cities are your gods, O Judah.
Why will you contend with Me? You all have transgressed against Me, declares the LORD.
In vain I struck your children; they received no correction. Your sword has devoured your prophets like a destroying lion.
O generation, see the word of the LORD: Have I been a wilderness to Israel, or a land of thick darkness? Why do My people say, “We roam free; we will not come to You anymore”?
Does a virgin forget her adornment, or a bride her bridal attire? Yet My people have forgotten Me, days without number.
How well you adorn your way to seek love; therefore even the wicked women you have taught your ways.
Also in your skirts is found the blood of the souls of the poor innocents; you did not find them breaking in, but it is because of all these things.
Yet you say, “I am innocent; surely his anger has turned away from me.” Behold, I will enter into judgment with you, because you say, “I have not sinned.”
How greatly you go about changing your way! You shall also be put to shame by Egypt, just as you were put to shame by Assyria.
Also from this you shall go out, with your hands upon your head; for the LORD has rejected those in whom you trust, and you shall not prosper by them.

They say, If a man sends away his wife, and she goes from him and becomes another man’s, shall he return to her again? Would not that land be utterly defiled? But you have played the harlot with many lovers; yet return again to Me, declares the LORD.

Lift up your eyes to the bare heights and see: where have you not been violated? By the ways you sat for them, like an Arab in the wilderness, and you have polluted the land with your harlotries and with your wickedness.
Therefore the showers have been withheld, and the latter rain has not come; yet you had the forehead of a harlot, you refused to be ashamed.
Have you not from this time called to Me, My Father, You are the guide of my youth?
Will he keep his anger forever, will he guard it to the end? Behold, you have spoken and have done evil things, and you have prevailed.
And the LORD said to me in the days of Josiah the king, Have you seen what faithless Israel has done? She goes upon every high hill and under every green tree, and there she plays the harlot.
And I said, After she has done all these things, she will return to Me; but she did not return, and her treacherous sister Judah saw it.

And I saw that for all the causes for which faithless Israel committed adultery, I had sent her away and given her a bill of divorce; yet treacherous Judah her sister did not fear, but she also went and played the harlot.
And it came to pass, through the noise of her whoredom, that she defiled the land, and committed adultery with stone and with tree.
And yet for all this her treacherous sister Judah has not returned to Me with all her heart, but only in falsehood, declares the LORD.
And the LORD said to me, Faithful is the backsliding Israel more than treacherous Judah.

Go and proclaim these words toward the north, and say, Return, O backsliding Israel, declares the LORD; I will not cause My face to fall upon you in anger, for I am gracious, declares the LORD; I will not keep wrath forever.

Only acknowledge your iniquity, that you have transgressed against the LORD your God, and have scattered your ways to strangers under every green tree, and to my voice you have not listened, declares the LORD.
Return, O backsliding children, declares the LORD, for I am married to you; and I will take you, one from a city and two from a family, and I will bring you to Zion.
And I will give you shepherds after My own heart, and they shall feed you with knowledge and understanding.

And it shall come to pass, when you multiply and are fruitful in the land in those days, declares the LORD, they shall no more say, “The ark of the covenant of the LORD.” It shall not come to mind, nor shall they remember it, nor shall they miss it, nor shall it be made again.

At that time they will call Jerusalem the throne of the LORD, and all the nations will be gathered to her, to the name of the LORD, to Jerusalem; and they will no longer walk after the stubbornness of their evil heart.
In those days the house of Judah shall walk with the house of Israel, and they shall come together out of the land of the north to the land that I caused your fathers to inherit.

But I said, How I would set you among the sons, and give you a pleasant land, a heritage most beautiful among the hosts of nations. And I said, You shall call Me, My Father, and shall not turn away from following Me.
Surely, as a wife treacherously departs from her companion, so have you dealt treacherously with Me, O house of Israel, declares the LORD.
A voice is heard upon the heights, the weeping supplications of the sons of Israel, for they have perverted their way, they have forgotten the LORD their God.
Return, O backsliding children; I will heal your turnings away. Behold, we come to you, for you are the LORD our God.
Truly, in vain is salvation hoped for from the hills, the tumult of the mountains; truly, in the LORD our God is the salvation of Israel.
But the shameful thing has devoured the labor of our fathers from our youth, their flocks and their herds, their sons and their daughters.

Let us lie down in our shame, and let our dishonor cover us; for against the LORD our God we have sinned, we and our fathers, from our youth even to this day, and we have not listened to the voice of the LORD our God.
If you will return, O Israel, declares the LORD, then to Me you shall return; and if you will remove your abominations from before My face, then you shall not wander.
And you shall swear, “As the LORD lives,” in truth, in justice, and in righteousness; and in him the nations shall bless themselves, and in him they shall glory.
For thus says the LORD to the men of Judah and to Jerusalem: Break up for yourselves a fallow ground, and do not sow among thorns.

Circumcise yourselves to the LORD, and remove the foreskins of your heart, men of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem, lest my fury go forth like fire and burn with none to quench it, because of the evil of your deeds.
Declare in Judah, and proclaim in Jerusalem, and say, and blow the trumpet in the land; cry aloud and say, “Gather yourselves, and let us go into the fortified cities.”
Lift up a banner toward Zion; seek refuge, do not stand still, for I am bringing evil from the north, and great destruction.
A lion has come up from his thicket, and a destroyer of nations has set out; he has gone forth from his place to make your land a desolation. Your cities shall be laid waste, without inhabitant.
For this gird yourselves with sackcloth, lament and wail, for the fierce anger of the LORD has not turned back from us.

And it shall come to pass in that day, declares the LORD, that the heart of the king shall perish, and the heart of the princes; and the priests shall be appalled, and the prophets shall be astonished.
And I said, Alas, Lord GOD! Surely You have utterly deceived this people and Jerusalem, saying, You shall have peace, whereas the sword reaches to the very soul.
At that time it shall be said to this people and to Jerusalem: A scorching wind from the bare heights in the wilderness, on the way of the daughter of my people, not to winnow and not to cleanse.
A wind too full for these shall come for Me; now I also will speak judgments against them.
Behold, he comes up like clouds, and his chariots like the whirlwind; swifter than eagles are his horses. Woe to us, for we are plundered.
Wash your heart from evil, O Jerusalem, that you may be saved. How long will your wicked thoughts lodge within you?
For a voice declares from Dan, and proclaims calamity from the hill country of Ephraim.
Make mention to the nations; behold, proclaim concerning Jerusalem: watchers are coming from a far land, and they have lifted up their voice against the cities of Judah.
Like keepers of a field they are against her round about, for against Me she has rebelled, declares the LORD.
Your way and your deeds have done these things to you; this is your evil, how bitter it is, for it reaches to your heart.

My inward parts, my inward parts! I writhe in pain; O the walls of my heart! My heart is in tumult within me; I cannot keep silent, for the sound of the trumpet my soul has heard, the battle cry of war.
Destruction upon destruction is proclaimed, for the whole land is laid waste; suddenly my tents are ravaged, in an instant my curtains.
How long shall I see the banner and hear the sound of the trumpet?
For My people are foolish, they have not known Me; they are senseless children, and they are without understanding. Wise are they to do evil, but to do good they do not know.
I beheld the earth, and behold, it was waste and void; and the heavens, and there was no light in them.
I beheld the mountains, and, behold, they trembled, and all the hills swayed to and fro.
I looked, and behold, there was no man, and all the birds of the heavens had fled.
I beheld, and lo, the fruitful land was a wilderness, and all its cities were broken down before the LORD, before the heat of His anger.
For thus says the LORD: Desolation shall the whole land be; yet a full end I will not make.
Because of this the earth shall mourn, and the heavens above shall be darkened, because I have spoken, I have purposed, and I will not relent, neither will I turn back from it.
At the sound of the horseman and the archer every city flees; they go into the thickets and climb upon the rocks. Every city is forsaken, and no man dwells in them.

And you, O desolate one, what will you do? Though you clothe yourself with scarlet, though you adorn yourself with ornaments of gold, though you enlarge your eyes with kohl, in vain you make yourself beautiful; your lovers despise you, they seek your life.

For I have heard a voice as of a woman in labor, anguish as of one bearing her first child, the voice of the daughter of Zion gasping for breath; she spreads out her hands: “Woe now is me, for my soul faints before the killers.”

Roam to and fro through the streets of Jerusalem, and see now, and know, and seek in her broad places if you can find a man, if there is any who does justice, who seeks faithfulness, and I will pardon her.
And though they say, “As the LORD lives,” surely they swear falsely.

O LORD, are not Your eyes upon faithfulness? You struck them, but they did not ache; You consumed them, yet they refused to receive correction. They made their faces harder than rock; they refused to return.
But as for me, I said, “Surely they are the poor; they have acted foolishly, for they have not known the way of the LORD, the judgment of their God.”
I will go to the great men and will speak to them, for they know the way of the LORD, the judgment of their God; but they together have broken the yoke, they have torn apart the bonds.

Therefore a lion from the forest shall strike them down, a wolf of the deserts shall ravage them, a leopard is watching over their cities; everyone who goes out from there shall be torn in pieces, because their transgressions are many, their backslidings are mighty.
How for this shall I pardon you? Your sons have forsaken Me and have sworn by what is no god. Though I satisfied them, they committed adultery, and in the house of a harlot they thronged together.
They were well-fed stallions, roaming at daybreak; each one neighed after his neighbor’s wife.
Shall I not punish for these things? declares the LORD; and shall not My soul avenge itself on a nation such as this?
Go up upon her walls and destroy, but make not a full end; take away her branches, for they are not the LORD’s.
For the house of Israel and the house of Judah have indeed dealt treacherously against Me, declares the LORD.
They have denied the LORD and said, “It is not he; evil shall not come upon us, nor shall we see sword or famine.”
And the prophets shall become wind, and the word is not in them; thus shall it be done to them.
Therefore thus says the LORD, the God of hosts: Because you have spoken this word, behold, I am making My words in your mouth a fire, and this people wood, and it shall devour them.

Behold, I am bringing upon you a nation from afar, O house of Israel, declares the LORD; a mighty nation it is, an ancient nation it is, a nation whose language you do not know, and you will not understand what it speaks.
Their quiver is like an open grave; all of them are mighty men.

And it shall eat your harvest and your bread; they shall eat your sons and your daughters; it shall eat your flock and your herd; it shall eat your vine and your fig tree; it shall demolish with the sword your fortified cities in which you trust.
Yet even in those days, declares the LORD, I will not make a full end of you.

And it shall come to pass, when you say, “For what reason has the LORD our God done all these things to us?” then you shall say to them, “As you have forsaken Me and served foreign gods in your own land, so shall you serve strangers in a land that is not yours.”
Declare this in the house of Jacob, and cause it to be heard in Judah, saying:
Hear now this, O foolish people, and without heart; who have eyes but do not see, who have ears but do not hear.

Do you not fear Me? declares the LORD. Will you not tremble at My presence, who set the sand as a boundary for the sea, an everlasting decree that it cannot pass over? Though its waves toss themselves, they are not able; though its billows roar, they do not cross over it.
But this people has a stubborn and rebellious heart; they have turned aside and gone their way.
And they have not said in their heart, Let us now fear the LORD our God, who gives rain, the early and the latter rain in its season, who keeps for us the appointed weeks of the harvest.
Your iniquities have turned away these things, and your sins have withheld the good from you.
For wicked men are found among My people; they watch, crouching like fowlers; they set a deadly snare, they catch men.
As a cage is full of birds, so their houses are full of deceit; therefore they have grown great and have become rich.

They have grown fat, they have grown sleek; indeed, they overflow with deeds of wickedness. The cause of the orphan they did not judge, that they might prosper, and the justice of the poor they did not uphold.
Shall I not punish for these things? declares the LORD. Shall not my soul avenge itself on a nation such as this?
An appalling and horrible thing has come to pass in the land.
The prophets prophesy falsely, and the priests rule by their hand, and My people love to have it so; but what will you do in the end of it?
Take refuge, O sons of Benjamin, from the midst of Jerusalem, and in Tekoa blow the trumpet, and over Beth-haccherem lift up a signal, for evil looks forth from the north, and great destruction.
The comely and delicate one, the daughter of Zion, I have likened her.
to her shall shepherds come with their flocks; they shall pitch their tents against her round about; they shall pasture each one in his place.
Sanctify war against her; arise, and let us go up at noonday. Woe to us, for the day declines, for the shadows of evening are stretched out.
Arise, and let us go up by night, and let us destroy her palaces.
For thus says the LORD of hosts: Cut down her trees and cast up a siege mound against Jerusalem; this is the city to be punished, for all within her is oppression in her midst.
As a well keeps its waters fresh, so she keeps fresh her wickedness; violence and spoil are heard in her, before me continually are sickness and wound.
Be instructed, O Jerusalem, lest My soul be torn from you, lest I make you a desolation, a land not inhabited.
Thus says the LORD of hosts: They shall glean, glean as a vine the remnant of Israel; turn back your hand like a grape-gatherer over the branches.

To whom shall I speak and give warning, that they may hear? Behold, their ear is uncircumcised, and they are not able to listen. Behold, the word of the LORD has become to them a reproach; they take no delight in it.

But I am full of the fury of the LORD; I am weary with holding it in. Pour it out upon the children in the street, and upon the gathering of young men together; for both husband and wife shall be taken, the old man with him who is full of days.
Their houses shall be turned over to others, fields and wives together, for I will stretch out My hand against the inhabitants of the land, declares the LORD.
For from the least of them even to the greatest of them, all of them are greedy for gain; and from prophet even to priest, all of them deal falsely.
They have healed the fracture of My people lightly, saying, “Peace, peace,” when there is no peace.

They were ashamed, for they have committed abomination; yet they were not at all ashamed, neither did they know how to blush. Therefore they shall fall among those who fall; at the time that I punish them they shall stumble, says the LORD.
Thus says the LORD: Stand by the ways and see, and ask for the ancient paths, where the good way is, and walk in it, and you shall find rest for your souls. But they said, We will not walk in it.
And I set watchmen over you, saying, Listen to the sound of the trumpet. But they said, We will not listen.
Therefore hear, O nations, and know, O congregation, what is among them.
Hear, O earth: behold, I am bringing evil upon this people, the fruit of their thoughts, because they have not listened to My words, and as for My law, they have rejected it.
Why then is frankincense coming to Me from Sheba, and the sweet cane from a distant land? Your burnt offerings are not acceptable, and your sacrifices do not please Me.
Therefore thus says the LORD: Behold, I am setting before this people stumbling blocks, and they shall stumble over them, fathers and sons together; neighbor and his companion, and they shall perish.
Thus says the LORD: Behold, a people comes from the land of the north, and a great nation is stirred up from the uttermost parts of the earth.
They grasp bow and spear; cruel are they and will not show mercy. Their voice roars like the sea, and on horses they ride, arrayed as a man for battle against you, O daughter of Zion.
We have heard the report of it; our hands grow feeble, anguish has seized us, pain as of a woman in labor.
Do not go out into the field, and do not walk on the road; for the sword of the enemy is terror on every side.
O daughter of my people, gird yourself with sackcloth and wallow in ashes; make mourning for an only son, most bitter lamentation, for suddenly the destroyer will come upon us.
As an assayer I have set you among My people, a fortress, that you may know and test their way.
All of them are stubborn rebels, walking as slanderers; bronze and iron are they, all of them are destroyers.
The bellows blow fiercely, the fire consumes the lead; in vain the refiner refines, for the wicked are not separated.
Rejected silver they shall call them, for the LORD has rejected them.
The word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying,
Stand in the gate of the house of the LORD, and proclaim there this word, and say, Hear the word of the LORD, all Judah who enter in at these gates to bow yourselves down before the LORD.
Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: Amend your ways and your deeds, and I will cause you to dwell in this place.
Do not trust in deceptive words, saying, “The temple of the LORD, the temple of the LORD, the temple of the LORD, these are.”
For if you thoroughly amend your ways and your deeds, if you indeed practice justice between a man and his neighbor,
Do not oppress the sojourner, the fatherless, or the widow, and do not shed innocent blood in this place, nor walk after other gods to your own hurt.
Then I will cause you to dwell in this place, in the land that I gave to your fathers, from of old and forever.
Behold, you are trusting for yourselves in lying words, that cannot profit.
Will you steal, murder, and commit adultery, and swear falsely, and burn incense to Baal, and walk after other gods whom you have not known?
Then you come and stand before Me in this house which is called by My name, and say, “We are delivered,” that you may do all these abominations.
Has this house, which is called by My name, become in your eyes a den of robbers? Behold, I, even I, have seen it, declares the LORD.
For go now to My place that was in Shiloh, where I caused My name to dwell at the first, and see what I did to it because of the evil of My people Israel.
And now, because you have done all these deeds, declares the LORD, and I spoke to you, rising early and speaking, but you did not listen, and I called to you, but you did not answer.
And I will do to the house which is called by My name, in which you trust, and to the place that I gave to you and to your fathers, as I have done to Shiloh.
And I will cast you out from before My face, as I cast out all your brethren, even all the seed of Ephraim.
As for you, do not pray for this people, and do not lift up for them cry or prayer, and do not intercede with Me, for I am not listening to you.
Do you not see what they are doing in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?

The children gather wood, and the fathers kindle the fire, and the women knead the dough, to make cakes for the queen of heaven, and to pour out drink offerings to other gods, in order to provoke Me to anger.
Is it I whom they provoke? says the LORD. Is it not themselves, to the shame of their own faces?

Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: Behold, my anger and my wrath are poured out upon this place, upon man and upon beast, and upon the tree of the field and upon the fruit of the ground; and it shall burn and not be quenched.
Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: Add your burnt offerings to your sacrifices, and eat flesh.
For I did not speak with your fathers, nor command them in the day that I brought them out of the land of Egypt, concerning matters of burnt offering and sacrifice.
But this thing I commanded them, saying, Listen to My voice, and I will be to you God, and you shall be to Me a people; and walk in all the way that I command you, that it may be well with you.
But they did not listen and did not incline their ear, but walked in the counsels and in the stubbornness of their evil heart, and they became backward and not forward.
From the day that your fathers came out of the land of Egypt until this day, I sent to you all My servants the prophets, daily rising early and sending them.
But they did not listen to Me, nor did they incline their ear; they stiffened their neck, they did worse than their fathers.
And you shall speak all these words to them, but they will not listen to you; and you shall call to them, but they will not answer you.
And you shall say to them, This is the nation that did not listen to the voice of the LORD their God, and did not receive correction; truth has perished and is cut off from their mouth.
Shear off your consecrated hair and cast it away, and lift up a lamentation on the bare heights; for the LORD has rejected and forsaken the generation of his wrath.
For the sons of Judah have done the evil in My sight, declares the LORD; they have set their abominations in the house which is called by My name, to defile it.

And they have built the high places of Topheth, which is in the Valley of the son of Hinnom, to burn their sons and their daughters in the fire, which I did not command, nor did it come up upon My heart.

Therefore, behold, days are coming, declares the LORD, when it shall no more be called Topheth, nor the Valley of the Son of Hinnom, but the Valley of Slaughter; and they shall bury in Topheth, for there will be no room elsewhere.
And the carcass of this people shall be for food to the birds of the heavens and to the beasts of the earth, and none shall frighten them away.

And I will cause to cease from the cities of Judah and from the streets of Jerusalem the voice of joy and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride; for the land shall become a desolation.

At that time, declares the LORD, they shall bring out the bones of the kings of Judah, and the bones of its princes, and the bones of the priests, and the bones of the prophets, and the bones of the inhabitants of Jerusalem, from their graves.

And they shall be spread before the sun and the moon and all the host of heaven, which they have loved and which they have served, and after which they have walked, and which they have sought, and which they have bowed down to. They shall not be gathered nor buried; for dung upon the face of the ground they shall be.
And death shall be chosen rather than life by all the remnant that remains of this evil family, in all the places where I have driven them, declares the LORD of hosts.
And you shall say to them, Thus says the LORD: Do men fall and not arise? Does one turn away and not return?
Why then has this people, Jerusalem, turned away in perpetual backsliding? They hold fast to deceit, they refuse to return.
I listened and heard, but they do not speak aright; no man repents of his evil, saying, “What have I done?” Each one turns back to his own course, like a horse rushing headlong into the battle.
Even the stork in the heavens knows her appointed times, and the turtledove and the swift and the crane keep the time of their coming; but my people do not know the judgment of the LORD.
How can you say, “We are wise, and the law of the LORD is with us”? Behold, surely the lying pen of the scribes has made it into a lie.
The wise are put to shame, they are dismayed and taken; behold, they have rejected the word of the LORD, and what wisdom is in them?

Therefore I will give their wives to others, and their fields to possessors; for from the least even to the greatest, all of them are greedy for gain; from prophet even to priest, all of them practice falsehood.
They have healed the wound of the daughter of My people lightly, saying, “Peace, peace,” when there is no peace.

They are put to shame, for they have committed abomination; yet they are not at all ashamed, neither do they know how to blush. Therefore they shall fall among those who fall; in the time of their visitation they shall stumble, says the LORD.
I will surely sweep them away, declares the LORD; there are no grapes on the vine, nor figs on the fig tree, and the leaf has withered, and what I gave them shall pass away from them.

Why are we sitting still? Assemble yourselves, and let us enter into the fortified cities and be silent there, for the LORD our God has silenced us and has made us drink the water of gall, for we have sinned against the LORD.
We looked for peace, but no good came; for a time of healing, and behold, terror.

From Dan is heard the snorting of his horses; at the sound of the neighing of his mighty ones the whole land trembles. They come and devour the land and all that fills it, the city and those who dwell in it.
For behold, I am sending among you serpents, vipers that cannot be charmed, and they shall bite you, declares the LORD.
My comfort in sorrow is faint within me; my heart within me is sick.

Behold, the cry of the daughter of my people from a land far away: “Is the LORD not in Zion? Is her King not in her?” “Why have they provoked Me to anger with their carved images, with foreign vanities?”
Harvest is past, summer is ended, and we are not saved.
For the brokenness of the daughter of my people I am broken; I mourn, desolation has taken hold of me.
Is there no balm in Gilead, is there no physician there? Why then has the healing of the daughter of my people not come up?
Oh that my head were waters, and my eyes a fountain of tears, that I might weep day and night for the slain of the daughter of my people.
Oh that I had in the wilderness a lodging place of travelers, that I might leave my people and go from them! For they are all adulterers, an assembly of treacherous men.
They bend their tongue like their bow for falsehood, and not for faithfulness have they grown strong in the land; for from evil to evil they proceed, and Me they do not know, declares the LORD.
Each one, beware of his neighbor, and in no brother put your trust; for every brother will utterly supplant, and every neighbor goes about as a talebearer.
Each one deceives his neighbor, and truth they do not speak; they have trained their tongue to speak lies; they weary themselves with perverting.
Your dwelling is in the midst of deceit; through deceit they refuse to know Me, declares the LORD.
Therefore thus says the LORD of hosts: Behold, I will refine them and test them, for how else should I act because of the daughter of My people?
Their tongue is a sharpened arrow; it speaks deceit. With his mouth one speaks peace to his neighbor, but within him he sets an ambush.
Shall I not punish them for these things? declares the LORD. Shall not my soul avenge itself on a nation such as this?

Upon the mountains I will lift up weeping and wailing, and upon the pastures of the wilderness a lamentation, because they are laid waste, so that no man passes through, and they hear not the voice of cattle; from the birds of the heavens even to the beasts they have fled, they are gone.
And I will make Jerusalem a heap of ruins, a lair of jackals; and the cities of Judah I will make a desolation, without inhabitant.

Who is the wise man, that he may understand this? And who is he to whom the mouth of the LORD has spoken, that he may declare it: For what cause has the land perished, is it burned like a wilderness, so that none passes through?
And the LORD says, Because they have forsaken My law which I set before them, and have not listened to My voice, nor walked in it.
But they walked after the stubbornness of their own heart, and after the Baals, which their fathers had taught them.
Therefore thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I will feed this people with wormwood, and give them poisoned water to drink.
And I will scatter them among the nations, whom neither they nor their fathers have known; and I will send the sword after them, until I have consumed them.
Thus says the LORD of hosts: Consider now, and call for the mourning women, that they may come; and send for the skillful women, that they may come.
And let them make haste and lift up a wailing over us, that our eyes may run down with tears, and our eyelids pour out water.
For a voice of wailing is heard from Zion: How we are ruined! We are greatly ashamed, for we have forsaken the land, for they have cast down our dwellings.
For hear, O women, the word of the LORD, and let your ear receive the word of His mouth; and teach your daughters wailing, and every woman her neighbor a lamentation.
For death has come up into our windows, it has entered into our palaces, to cut off the little ones from the street, the young men from the open squares.
Speak: Thus says the LORD, The carcasses of men shall fall like dung upon the face of the field, and like the sheaf after the reaper, and none shall gather them.
Thus says the LORD: Let not the wise man glory in his wisdom, let not the mighty man glory in his might, let not the rich man glory in his riches.

But let the one who boasts boast in this: that he understands and knows Me, that I am the LORD who practices lovingkindness, justice, and righteousness in the earth; for in these things I delight, declares the LORD.
Behold, days are coming, declares the LORD, when I will punish all who are circumcised yet uncircumcised.

upon Egypt, and upon Judah, and upon Edom, and upon the children of Ammon, and upon Moab, and upon all that have the corners of their hair cut, who dwell in the wilderness; for all the nations are uncircumcised, and all the house of Israel are uncircumcised in heart.
Hear the word that the LORD has spoken concerning you, O house of Israel.
Thus says the LORD: To the way of the nations you shall not learn, and from the signs of the heavens you shall not be dismayed, for the nations are dismayed by them.
For the statutes of the peoples are vanity; for one cuts a tree out of the forest, the work of the hands of a craftsman with the chisel.
They deck it with silver and with gold; they fasten it with nails and with hammers, that it move not.

They are like a scarecrow in a cucumber field, and cannot speak; they must indeed be carried, because they cannot walk. Do not be afraid of them, for they cannot do evil, and also to do good is not in them.
There is none like You, O LORD; great are You, and great is Your name in might.
Who would not fear You, O King of the nations? For it is fitting to You; for among all the wise ones of the nations, and in all their kingdoms, there is none like You.
But they are altogether brutish and foolish; the instruction of vanities is wood.
Beaten silver is brought from Tarshish, and gold from Uphaz, the work of a craftsman and of the hands of a goldsmith; blue and purple are their clothing, all of them the work of skillful men.
But the LORD is the true God; he is the living God and the everlasting King. At his wrath the earth trembles, and the nations are not able to endure his indignation.
Thus you shall say to them: The gods that did not make the heavens and the earth shall perish from the earth and from under these heavens.
He who made the earth by His power, who established the world by His wisdom, and by His understanding stretched out the heavens.

At the sound of His giving, there is a tumult of waters in the heavens, and He causes vapors to ascend from the ends of the earth; He makes lightning for the rain, and brings forth the wind from His treasuries.
Every man is brutish without knowledge; every goldsmith is put to shame by his carved image, for his molten image is a lie, and there is no breath in them.
Vanity they are, a work of delusions; in the time of their visitation they shall perish.
Not like these is the portion of Jacob, for He is the Former of all things, and Israel is the tribe of His inheritance; the LORD of hosts is His name.
Gather up your bundle from the land, O you who dwell in the siege.
For thus says the LORD: Behold, I am slinging out the inhabitants of the land at this time, and I will bring distress upon them, that they may find it so.
Woe is me for my hurt! My wound is grievous; but I said, Surely this is my sickness, and I will bear it.
My tent is plundered, and all my cords are torn apart; my children have gone out from me, and they are no more. There is none to stretch out my tent any longer, and to set up my curtains.
For the shepherds have become brutish and have not inquired of the LORD; therefore they have not prospered, and all their flock is scattered.
A voice of report, behold, it comes, and a great tumult from the land of the north, to make the cities of Judah desolate, a lair of jackals.
I know, O LORD, that a man's way is not his own; it is not in one who walks to direct his steps.
Discipline me, O LORD, but in justice; not in your anger, lest you bring me to nothing.

Pour out Your wrath upon the nations that have not known You, and upon the families that have not called upon Your name; for they have devoured Jacob, yes, they have devoured him and consumed him, and have laid waste his habitation.
The word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying:
Hear the words of this covenant, and speak them to the men of Judah and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
And you shall say to them, Thus says the LORD, the God of Israel: Cursed is the man who does not obey the words of this covenant.

which I commanded your fathers in the day I brought them out of the land of Egypt, out of the iron furnace, saying, “Obey My voice, and do according to all that I command you; and you shall be My people, and I will be your God.”
In order to establish the oath which I swore to your fathers, to give them a land flowing with milk and honey, as it is this day. And I answered and said, Amen, O LORD.
And the LORD said to me, Proclaim all these words in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem, saying, Hear the words of this covenant and do them.
For I earnestly warned your fathers in the day I brought them up out of the land of Egypt, even to this day, rising early and testifying, saying, “Obey My voice.”

But they did not listen and did not incline their ear, but each one walked in the stubbornness of his evil heart. So I brought upon them all the words of this covenant which I commanded them to perform, but they did not perform them.
And the LORD said to me, A conspiracy is found among the men of Judah and among the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

They have turned back to the iniquities of their former fathers, who refused to listen to My words, and they have walked after other gods to serve them. The house of Israel and the house of Judah have broken My covenant which I made with their fathers.
Therefore thus says the LORD: Behold, I am bringing upon them calamity from which they shall not be able to escape; and they will cry out to Me, but I will not listen to them.
Then the cities of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem will go and cry out to the gods to whom they burn incense, but they will surely not save them at the time of their calamity.

For according to the number of your cities were your gods, O Judah, and according to the number of the streets of Jerusalem you have set up altars to the shameful thing, altars to burn incense to Baal.
But as for you, do not pray for this people, and do not lift up for them a cry or prayer, for I will not hear in the time that they call to Me because of their evil.
What has my beloved to do in my house, she who has done her many wicked schemes? Can holy flesh take away from you your evil, that then you may exult?
The LORD called your name, a green olive tree, fair with goodly fruit; with the sound of a great tumult he has kindled fire upon it, and its branches are broken.

And the LORD of hosts, who planted you, has spoken evil against you, because of the evil of the house of Israel and the house of Judah, which they have done to themselves, to provoke Me to anger by burning incense to Baal.
And the LORD made it known to me, and I knew; then You showed me their deeds.

But as for me, I was like a gentle lamb led to the slaughter, and I did not know that they had devised plans against me, saying, “Let us destroy the tree with its fruit, and cut him off from the land of the living, that his name be remembered no more.”
But the LORD of hosts judges righteously, testing the kidneys and the heart; let me see Your vengeance on them, for to You I have laid open my cause.
Therefore thus says the LORD concerning the men of Anathoth, who seek your life, saying, “You shall not prophesy in the name of the LORD, lest you die by our hand.”
Therefore thus says the LORD of hosts: Behold, I will punish them; the young men shall die by the sword, their sons and their daughters shall die by famine.
And there shall be no remnant for them, for I will bring evil upon the men of Anathoth, the year of their visitation.
Righteous are You, O LORD, when I contend with You; yet I will speak judgments with You: Why does the way of the wicked prosper? Why are all who deal treacherously at ease?
You have planted them, yes, they have taken root; they go on, yes, they bear fruit. You are near in their mouth, but far from their inward parts.
But you, O LORD, know me; you see me and examine my heart with you. Set them apart like sheep for slaughter, and consecrate them for the day of killing.
How long shall the land mourn, and the grass of every field wither, for the evil of those who dwell in it? The beasts and the birds are consumed, because they say, “He will not see our latter end.”
For if you have run with footmen and they have wearied you, then how will you contend with horses? And in a land of peace you feel secure, but how will you do in the thicket of the Jordan?

For even your brothers and the house of your father, even they have dealt treacherously with you; even they have cried aloud after you with a full voice. Do not trust in them, though they speak good words to you.
I have forsaken My house, I have abandoned My heritage; I have given the beloved of My soul into the hand of her enemies.
My heritage has become to me like a lion in the forest; she has lifted up her voice against me, therefore I have come to hate her.
Is My heritage to Me a speckled bird of prey? Are the birds of prey round about against her? Come, gather all the beasts of the field, bring them to devour.
Many shepherds have ruined my vineyard, they have trampled my portion underfoot; they have made the portion of my delight a desolate wilderness.
He has made it a desolation; it mourns before Me, laid waste. The whole land is desolate, because no man lays it to heart.
Upon all the bare heights in the wilderness destroyers have come, for the sword of the LORD devours from one end of the land even to the other end of the land; no peace is there for any flesh.
They have sown wheat, but thorns they have reaped; they have worn themselves out, yet it does not profit. And you are put to shame because of your produce, because of the fierce anger of the LORD.

Thus says the LORD concerning all My evil neighbors who touch the inheritance which I have caused My people Israel to inherit: Behold, I am about to uproot them from off their land, and the house of Judah I will uproot from among them.
And it shall come to pass, after I have plucked them up, that I will return and have compassion on them, and I will bring them back, each man to his inheritance and each man to his land.

And it shall come to pass, if they will diligently learn the ways of My people, to swear by My name, “As the LORD lives,” just as they taught My people to swear by Baal, then they shall be built up in the midst of My people.
But if they will not listen, then I will uproot that nation, uprooting and destroying, declares the LORD.
Thus says the LORD to me: Go and buy for yourself a linen waistband, and put it upon your loins, but do not bring it into water.
So I bought the waistband according to the word of the LORD, and I put it upon my loins.
And the word of the LORD came to me a second time, saying,
Take the waistband that you have bought, which is upon your loins, and arise, go to the Euphrates, and hide it there in a cleft of the rock.
So I went and hid it by the Euphrates, as the LORD commanded me.
And it came to pass after many days that the LORD said to me, Arise, go to the Euphrates, and take from there the belt which I commanded you to hide there.
So I went to the Euphrates and dug, and took the belt from the place where I had hidden it; and behold, the belt was ruined, it was good for nothing.
And the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
Thus says the LORD: In this manner will I ruin the pride of Judah and the great pride of Jerusalem.

This evil people, who refuse to listen to My words, who walk in the stubbornness of their heart and go after other gods to serve them and to bow down to them, shall be like this belt, which is good for nothing.

For as the waistband clings to the loins of a man, so I caused all the house of Israel and all the house of Judah to cling to Me, declares the LORD, to be for Me a people, and a name, and a praise, and a glory; but they would not listen.

And you shall say to them this word: Thus says the LORD, the God of Israel, Every jar shall be filled with wine. And they will say to you, Do we not surely know that every jar shall be filled with wine?

And you shall say to them, Thus says the LORD: Behold, I am about to fill with drunkenness all the inhabitants of this land, and the kings who sit for David upon his throne, and the priests, and the prophets, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

And I will dash them one against another, a man against his brother, and the fathers and the sons together, declares the LORD; I will not spare, nor will I pity, nor will I have compassion, from destroying them.
Hear and give ear; do not be proud, for the LORD has spoken.

Give glory to the LORD your God before He brings darkness, and before your feet stumble upon the mountains of twilight; and while you look for light, He turns it into the shadow of death, and makes it deep gloom.
But if you will not listen, my soul shall weep in secret because of your pride; and my eye shall weep bitterly and run down with tears, for the flock of the LORD is taken captive.
Say to the king and to the lady, “Humble yourselves, sit down, for your crown of splendor has come down from your heads.”
The cities of the Negev are shut up, and there is none to open; Judah is carried away captive, all of it is wholly carried away in peace.
Lift up your eyes and see those who come from the north. Where is the flock that was given you, your beautiful sheep?
What will you say when He appoints over you those whom you yourself have taught to be chiefs for your head? Will not pangs seize you, like a woman in labor?
And if you say in your heart, “Why have these things come upon me?” For the greatness of your iniquity your skirts are uncovered, your heels are made bare.
Can the Ethiopian change his skin, or the leopard his spots? Then you also could do good, who are accustomed to do evil.
And I will scatter them like chaff that passes away, before the wind of the wilderness.
This is your lot, the portion measured out to you from Me, declares the LORD, because you have forgotten Me and have trusted in falsehood.
I also, even I, have uncovered your skirts over your face, and your shame shall be seen.
Your adulteries and your neighings, the lewdness of your whoredom, upon the hills in the field I have seen your abominations. Woe to you, Jerusalem! You will not be made clean; after how long yet?
The word of the LORD that came to Jeremiah concerning the matters of the droughts.
Judah mourns, and her gates languish; they are darkened down to the ground, and the cry of Jerusalem has gone up.
Their nobles sent their servants for water; they came to the cisterns, they found no water. They returned with their vessels empty; they were ashamed and confounded, and covered their heads.
Because of the ground that is cracked, for there has been no rain in the land, the farmers are ashamed, they cover their heads.
For even the doe in the field has given birth and forsaken her young, because there was no grass.
And the wild donkeys stood upon the bare heights, they panted for air like jackals; their eyes failed, because there was no grass.
Though our iniquities testify against us, O LORD, act for Your name’s sake; for our backslidings are many, against You we have sinned.
O hope of Israel, its Savior in time of distress, why will You be as a stranger in the land, and as a traveler who turns aside to lodge for a night?
Why should You be as a man astonished, as a mighty man who cannot save? Yet You, O LORD, are in our midst, and Your name is called upon us; do not forsake us.

Thus says the LORD concerning this people: So they have loved to wander, they have not restrained their feet; therefore the LORD does not accept them. Now He will remember their iniquity and visit their sins.
And the LORD said to me, Do not pray for this people for their good.
When they fast, I will not hear their cry; and when they offer burnt offering and grain offering, I will not accept them. For by the sword, and by famine, and by pestilence I will consume them.
Then I said, “Ah, Lord GOD, behold, the prophets are saying to them, ‘You shall not see the sword, and famine shall not befall you, for I will give you true peace in this place.’”

And the LORD said to me, “The prophets are prophesying falsehood in My name. I did not send them, nor did I command them, nor did I speak to them. A lying vision and divination, and a worthless thing and the deceit of their own heart—they are prophesying to you.”

Therefore thus says the LORD concerning the prophets who prophesy in My name, though I did not send them, yet they say, “Sword and famine shall not be in this land”: By sword and by famine those prophets shall come to an end.

And the people to whom they are prophesying shall be cast out in the streets of Jerusalem because of the famine and the sword, and none shall bury them—them, their wives, nor their sons, nor their daughters—and I will pour out upon them their own evil.

And you shall say to them this word: My eyes shall run down with tears night and day, and they shall not cease, for with a great breaking is broken the virgin daughter of my people, with a very grievous wound.
If I go out into the field, behold, those slain by the sword; and if I come into the city, behold, the diseases of famine. For both prophet and priest roam about in the land and do not know.

Have You utterly rejected Judah? Has Your soul loathed Zion? Why have You struck us, and there is no healing for us? We looked for peace, but no good came; and for a time of healing, and behold, terror.
We acknowledge, O LORD, our wickedness, the iniquity of our fathers, for we have sinned against you.
Do not spurn us, for the sake of Your name; do not dishonor the throne of Your glory. Remember, do not break Your covenant with us.
Are there among the vain idols of the nations any that bring rain? Or can the heavens give showers? Is it not you, O LORD our God? Therefore we wait for you, for you have made all these things.
And the LORD said to me, “Though Moses and Samuel stood before Me, yet My soul would not be toward this people; send them away from before My face, and let them go out.”

And it shall be, when they say to you, “Where shall we go out?” then you shall say to them, “Thus says the LORD: Those for death, to death; and those for the sword, to the sword; and those for famine, to famine; and those for captivity, to captivity.”
And I will appoint over them four kinds, declares the LORD: the sword to slay, and the dogs to drag away, and the birds of the heavens and the beasts of the earth to devour and to destroy.
And I will make them a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth, because of Manasseh son of Hezekiah, king of Judah, for that which he did in Jerusalem.
For who will have pity on you, O Jerusalem, or who will grieve for you? Or who will turn aside to ask of your welfare?
You have forsaken Me, declares the LORD; you keep going backward. So I have stretched out My hand against you and destroyed you; I am weary of relenting.
And I winnowed them with a winnowing-fork in the gates of the land; I bereaved, I destroyed my people; from their ways they did not turn back.

Their widows have become many to me beyond the sand of the seas; I have brought against them, against the mother of the young man, a destroyer at noonday; I have caused upon her to fall suddenly anguish and terrors.

She who bore seven languishes; she has breathed out her life. Her sun has gone down while it is yet day; she is ashamed and confounded. And the remnant of them I will give to the sword before their enemies, declares the LORD.
Alas for me, my mother, that you have borne me, a man of strife and a man of contention to all the land! I have not lent, nor have they lent to me, yet all of them curse me.
The LORD said, Surely I will set you free for good; surely I will cause the enemy to entreat you in the time of evil and in the time of distress.
Can one break iron, iron from the north, and bronze?
Your wealth and your treasures I will give for plunder without price, because of all your sins and in all your borders.
And I will cause your enemies to pass over into a land that you do not know, for a fire is kindled in My anger against you; it shall burn.
You know, O LORD; remember me and visit me, and avenge me of my persecutors. In your long-suffering do not take me away; know that for your sake I bear reproach.
Your words were found, and I ate them, and your word became to me the joy and rejoicing of my heart; for your name is called upon me, O LORD God of hosts.
I did not sit in the company of revelers and rejoice; because of Your hand I sat alone, for with indignation You have filled me.
Why is my pain unceasing, and my wound incurable, refusing to be healed? Will you indeed be to me like a deceptive stream, waters that are not reliable?

Therefore thus says the LORD: If you return, then I will restore you, that you may stand before Me; and if you bring forth the precious from the vile, you shall be as My mouth. They shall turn to you, but you shall not turn to them.

And I will make you to this people a fortified wall of bronze; and they shall fight against you, but they shall not prevail against you, for I am with you to save you and to deliver you, declares the LORD.
And I will deliver you out of the hand of the wicked, and I will redeem you out of the grasp of the ruthless.
And the word of the LORD came to me, saying:
You shall not take a wife for yourself, nor shall you have sons or daughters in this place.

For thus says the LORD concerning the sons and concerning the daughters who are born in this place, and concerning their mothers who bear them, and concerning their fathers who beget them in this land.

They shall die of grievous diseases; they shall not be lamented, nor shall they be buried; they shall be as dung upon the face of the ground, and by the sword and by famine they shall come to an end, and their carcasses shall be food for the birds of the heavens and for the beasts of the earth.

For thus says the LORD: Do not enter the house of mourning, and do not go to lament or to grieve for them, for I have withdrawn My peace from this people, declares the LORD, even lovingkindness and mercies.
Both great and small shall die in this land; they shall not be buried, nor shall they be lamented for, nor shall any cut himself, nor make himself bald for them.
Nor shall they break bread for them in mourning, to comfort him for the dead, nor shall they give them the cup of consolations to drink for his father or for his mother.
And into the house of feasting you shall not enter, to sit with them to eat and to drink.

For thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I am causing to cease from this place, before your eyes and in your days, the voice of joy and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride.

And it shall come to pass, when you declare to this people all these words, they will say to you, “For what reason has the LORD spoken against us all this great evil? And what is our iniquity, and what is our sin that we have sinned against the LORD our God?”

And you shall say to them, Because your fathers have forsaken Me, declares the LORD, and have walked after other gods and served them and bowed down to them, but Me they have forsaken, and My law they have not kept.
And you have done even more evil than your fathers, and behold, you are walking each one after the stubbornness of his evil heart, so as not to listen to Me.
And I will hurl you out from this land into a land that you and your fathers have not known, and there you shall serve other gods day and night, for I will show you no favor.
Therefore, behold, days are coming, declares the LORD, when it shall no more be said, “As the LORD lives, who brought up the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt,”

But, As the LORD lives, who brought up the children of Israel from the land of the north and from all the lands where He had driven them, and I will bring them back to their own land which I gave to their fathers.

Behold, I am sending for many fishers, declares the LORD, and they shall fish them; and afterward I will send for many hunters, and they shall hunt them from every mountain and from every hill and from the clefts of the rocks.
For My eyes are upon all their ways; they are not hidden from before My face, nor is their iniquity concealed from before My eyes.

And I will first repay double for their iniquity and their sin, because they have profaned My land; with the carcasses of their detestable things and their abominations they have filled My inheritance.

O LORD, my strength and my stronghold, and my refuge in the day of distress, to you nations shall come from the ends of the earth and shall say, “Surely our fathers have inherited lies, vanity, and in them there is no profit.”
Shall a man make gods to himself, and they are no gods?
Therefore, behold, I am making them know, this time I will make them know My hand and My might, and they shall know that My name is the LORD.
The sin of Judah is written with an iron pen, with a point of flint; it is engraved upon the tablet of their heart, and upon the horns of your altars.
While their children remember their altars and their Asherim by every green tree, upon the high hills.
My mountain in the field, your wealth, all your treasures, I will give for plunder, your high places, because of sin, throughout all your borders.

And you, even of yourself, shall let go of your inheritance that I gave you, and I will make you serve your enemies in a land that you do not know; for you have kindled a fire in My anger, which shall burn forever.
Thus says the LORD: Cursed is the man who trusts in man and makes flesh his arm, and whose heart turns away from the LORD.
For he shall be like a shrub in the desert, and shall not see when good comes, but shall dwell in parched places in the wilderness, a salt land and not inhabited.
Blessed is the man who trusts in the LORD, and whose trust is the LORD.

And he shall be like a tree planted by waters, that sends out its roots by a stream, and shall not fear when heat comes, but its leaf shall be green; and in the year of drought it shall not be anxious, nor shall it cease from yielding fruit.
The heart is deceitful above all things, and desperately sick; who can know it?
I, the LORD, search the heart, I test the inward parts, to give to each man according to his ways, according to the fruit of his deeds.
Like a partridge that broods over what it did not lay, so is he who makes wealth and not by justice; in the midst of his days it shall forsake him, and at his end he shall be a fool.
A glorious throne, exalted from the beginning, is the place of our sanctuary.
O hope of Israel, O LORD, all who forsake You shall be put to shame; those who turn away from You shall be written in the earth, because they have forsaken the fountain of living waters, the LORD.
Heal me, O LORD, and I shall be healed; save me, and I shall be saved, for you are my praise.
Behold, they say to me, “Where is the word of the LORD? Let it now come.”
As for me, I have not withdrawn from being a shepherd after You, and the grievous day I have not desired; You know, that which has gone forth from my lips was before Your face.
Do not be a terror to me; you are my refuge in the day of evil.
Let my pursuers be put to shame, but let me not be put to shame; let them be dismayed, but let me not be dismayed. Bring upon them the day of evil, and with double destruction break them.
Thus says the LORD to me: Go and stand in the gate of the sons of the people, by which the kings of Judah come in and by which they go out, and in all the gates of Jerusalem.
And you shall say to them, Hear the word of the LORD, O kings of Judah, and all Judah, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, who enter in by these gates.
Thus says the LORD: Guard your souls carefully, and do not lift a burden on the Sabbath day, nor bring it in through the gates of Jerusalem.
And you shall bring no burden out of your houses on the Sabbath day, and you shall do no work, but you shall sanctify the Sabbath day, as I commanded your fathers.
But they did not listen, nor did they incline their ear, but stiffened their neck, so as not to hear and not to receive instruction.

And it shall come to pass, if you diligently listen to Me, declares the LORD, to bring no burden through the gates of this city on the Sabbath day, but to hallow the Sabbath day, so as not to do any work in it,

Then shall there enter by the gates of this city kings and princes sitting upon the throne of David, riding in chariots and on horses, they and their princes, the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and this city shall be inhabited forever.

And they shall come from the cities of Judah and from all around Jerusalem, and from the land of Benjamin, and from the lowland, and from the hill country, and from the Negev, bringing burnt offering and sacrifice, and grain offering and frankincense, and those who bring thank offerings to the house of the LORD.

But if you will not listen to Me to hallow the Sabbath day, and not to bear a burden and enter in at the gates of Jerusalem on the Sabbath day, then I will kindle a fire in its gates, and it shall devour the palaces of Jerusalem, and it shall not be quenched.
The word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying,
Arise, and go down to the potter’s house, and there I will cause you to hear My words.
Then I went down to the potter’s house, and behold, he was doing work on the wheels.
And the vessel that he was making of clay was marred in the hand of the potter; so he turned and made it another vessel, as seemed right in the eyes of the potter to make it.
Then the word of the LORD came to me, saying:
Can I not do with you as this potter does, O house of Israel? declares the LORD. Behold, like the clay in the hand of the potter, so are you in My hand, O house of Israel.
At one moment I speak concerning a nation and concerning a kingdom, to pluck up and to pull down and to destroy.
But if that nation turns back from its evil of which I have spoken against it, then I will relent of the calamity that I thought to do to it.
And at another moment I speak concerning a nation and concerning a kingdom, to build and to plant it.
But if it does what is evil in My sight, not listening to My voice, then I will relent of the good with which I said I would benefit it.

And now, speak, I pray you, to the men of Judah and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, saying, Thus says the LORD: Behold, I am shaping evil against you and devising a plan against you. Return now, each one from his evil way, and amend your ways and your deeds.
But they say, It is hopeless; for after our own plans we will walk, and each one will do the stubbornness of his evil heart.
Therefore thus says the LORD: Inquire now among the nations, who has heard such things? A most horrible thing has the virgin Israel done.
Does the snow of Lebanon forsake the rock of the field? Or shall the cold, flowing waters from a distant place be dried up?
For My people have forgotten Me; to vanity they burn incense, and they have stumbled in their ways, the ancient paths, to walk in bypaths, a way not cast up.
To make their land a desolation of everlasting hissings; everyone who passes by it shall be appalled and shall wag his head.
Like an east wind I will scatter them before the enemy; I will show them the back and not the face in the day of their calamity.

And they said, Come, and let us devise devices against Jeremiah; for the law shall not perish from the priest, nor counsel from the wise, nor the word from the prophet. Come, and let us strike him with the tongue, and let us not give heed to any of his words.
Give heed to me, O LORD, and listen to the voice of those who contend with me.
Shall evil be repaid for good? For they have dug a pit for my soul. Remember how I stood before you to speak good on their behalf, to turn away your wrath from them.

Therefore give their children over to the famine, and deliver them up to the power of the sword; and let their wives be bereaved and widows, and their men be slain with death, their young men struck down by the sword in battle.
Let a cry be heard from their houses, when you bring a troop upon them suddenly; for they have dug a pit to take me, and snares they have hidden for my feet.

But you, O LORD, know all their counsel against me for death; do not forgive their iniquity, and their sin do not blot out from before you. Let them be made to stumble before you; in the time of your anger deal with them.
Thus says the LORD: Go and buy a potter’s earthenware flask, and take some of the elders of the people and some of the elders of the priests.
And you shall go out to the Valley of the son of Hinnom, which is by the entrance of the Potsherd Gate, and there you shall proclaim the words that I speak to you.

And you shall say, Hear the word of the LORD, O kings of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem. Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I am bringing evil upon this place, at which whoever hears of it, his ears shall tingle.

Because they have forsaken Me and have profaned this place, and have burned incense in it to other gods whom neither they, nor their fathers, nor the kings of Judah have known, and have filled this place with the blood of the innocent.
And they built the high places of Baal, to burn their sons in the fire as burnt offerings to Baal, which I did not command, nor speak, nor did it come up upon My heart.
Therefore, behold, days are coming, declares the LORD, when this place shall no more be called Topheth, nor the Valley of the son of Hinnom, but the Valley of Slaughter.

And I will make void the counsel of Judah and Jerusalem in this place, and I will cause them to fall by the sword before their enemies and by the hand of those who seek their life; and I will give their carcasses to be food for the birds of the heavens and for the beasts of the earth.
And I will make this city a desolation and a hissing; everyone who passes by it shall be appalled and shall hiss because of all her wounds.

And I will make them eat the flesh of their sons and the flesh of their daughters, and each shall eat the flesh of his neighbor, in the siege and in the distress with which their enemies and those who seek their life shall distress them.
Then you shall break the flask in the sight of the men who go with you.

And you shall say to them, Thus says the LORD of hosts: So will I break this people and this city, as one breaks the potter’s vessel, which cannot be made whole again; and in Topheth they shall bury, for there will be no place to bury.
So will I do to this place, declares the LORD, and to its inhabitants, and I will make this city like Topheth.

And the houses of Jerusalem and the houses of the kings of Judah shall be as the place of Topheth, unclean, even all the houses upon whose roofs they burned incense to all the host of heaven and poured out drink offerings to other gods.
Then Jeremiah came from Topheth, where the LORD had sent him to prophesy, and he stood in the court of the house of the LORD and said to all the people:

Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I am bringing upon this city and upon all her towns all the evil that I have spoken against her, because they have stiffened their neck, so as not to hear My words.
Now Pashhur the son of Immer the priest, who was chief officer in the house of the LORD, heard Jeremiah prophesying these words.
And Pashhur struck Jeremiah the prophet, and put him in the stocks that were in the Upper Benjamin Gate, which was in the house of the LORD.
And it came to pass on the next day that Pashhur brought Jeremiah out of the stocks. Then Jeremiah said to him, “The LORD does not call your name Pashhur, but Terror on Every Side.”

For thus says the LORD: Behold, I am making you a terror to yourself and to all your friends, and they shall fall by the sword of their enemies, and your eyes shall see it; and all Judah I will give into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall carry them captive to Babylon, and shall strike them down with the sword.

And I will give all the wealth of this city, and all its labor, and all its precious things, and all the treasures of the kings of Judah I will give into the hand of their enemies, and they shall plunder them and seize them and carry them to Babylon.

And you, Pashhur, and all who dwell in your house shall go into captivity; and to Babylon you shall come, and there you shall die, and there you shall be buried, you and all your lovers to whom you have prophesied lies.
You enticed me, O LORD, and I was enticed; you overpowered me and prevailed. I have become a laughingstock all the day; everyone mocks me.
For whenever I speak, I cry out; I call, “Violence and destruction!” For the word of the LORD has become to me a reproach and a derision all the day.
And I said, I will not remember Him, nor will I speak any more in His name; but it was in my heart like a burning fire shut up in my bones, and I was weary with holding it in, and I could not.

For I have heard the whispering of many, terror on every side: “Report, and we will report him.” All the men of my peace, those watching for my stumbling, say, “Perhaps he will be enticed, and we shall prevail against him, and we shall take our vengeance on him.”

But the LORD is with me as a mighty warrior; therefore my pursuers shall stumble and shall not prevail. They shall be greatly ashamed, for they have not acted wisely; an everlasting disgrace that shall not be forgotten.
But the LORD of hosts, who tests the righteous, who sees the kidneys and the heart, let me see Your vengeance on them, for to You I have laid open my cause.
Sing to the LORD, praise the LORD, for he has delivered the life of the poor from the hand of evildoers.
Cursed be the day on which I was born; the day when my mother bore me, let it not be blessed.
Cursed be the man who brought tidings to my father, saying, “A male child is born to you,” making him very glad.
And let that man be as the cities which the LORD overthrew and did not relent, and let him hear a cry in the morning and a shout of alarm at noonday.
Because he did not put me to death from the womb, so that my mother would have been my grave, and her womb forever pregnant.
Why then did I come forth from the womb, to see toil and sorrow, and that my days should be consumed with shame?
The word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD, when King Zedekiah sent to him Pashhur son of Malchiah and Zephaniah son of Maaseiah the priest, saying:
Inquire, I pray you, of the LORD for us, for Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon makes war against us; perhaps the LORD will deal with us according to all His wondrous works, that he may go up from us.
And Jeremiah said to them, Thus shall you say to Zedekiah:

Thus says the LORD, the God of Israel: Behold, I am turning back the weapons of war that are in your hands, with which you are fighting against the king of Babylon and against the Chaldeans who are besieging you outside the wall, and I will gather them into the midst of this city.
And I myself will fight against you with outstretched hand and with strong arm, and in anger and in wrath and in great fury.
And I will strike the inhabitants of this city, both man and beast; with a great pestilence they shall die.

And afterward, declares the LORD, I will give Zedekiah king of Judah, and his servants, and the people, and those who remain in this city from the pestilence, from the sword, and from the famine, into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, and into the hand of their enemies, and into the hand of those who seek their life; and he shall strike them with the edge of the sword; he shall not spare them, nor have pity, nor show mercy.
And to this people you shall say, Thus says the LORD: Behold, I set before you the way of life and the way of death.

He who dwells in this city shall die by the sword and by famine and by pestilence; but he who goes out and surrenders to the Chaldeans who are besieging you, he shall live, and his life shall be to him for spoil.
For I have set my face against this city for evil and not for good, declares the LORD; it shall be given into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall burn it with fire.
And concerning the house of the king of Judah: Hear the word of the LORD.

O house of David, thus says the LORD: Render judgment in the morning, and deliver the plundered out of the hand of the oppressor, lest my wrath go forth like fire and burn with none to quench it, because of the evil of your deeds.
Behold, I am against you, O inhabitant of the valley, O rock of the plain, declares the LORD, you who say, “Who shall come down against us, and who shall enter into our dwellings?”
And I will punish you according to the fruit of your deeds, declares the LORD; and I will kindle a fire in her forest, and it shall devour all that is round about her.
Thus says the LORD: Go down to the house of the king of Judah, and speak there this word.
And you shall say, Hear the word of the LORD, O king of Judah, who sits upon the throne of David, you, and your servants, and your people who enter in by these gates.

Thus says the LORD: Do justice and righteousness, and deliver the plundered out of the hand of the oppressor, and do not wrong or mistreat the sojourner, the fatherless, and the widow, and do not shed innocent blood in this place.
