Go and speak to Ebed-melech the Ethiopian, saying, Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I am bringing my words upon this city for evil and not for good, and they shall be fulfilled before your face in that day.
But I will deliver you in that day, declares the LORD, and you shall not be given into the hand of the men of whom you are afraid.
For I will surely deliver you, and you shall not fall by the sword, but your life shall be to you for spoil, because you have trusted in Me, declares the LORD.

The word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD, after Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had sent him away from Ramah, when he had taken him, being bound in chains in the midst of all the exiles of Jerusalem and Judah who were carried away to Babylon.
And the captain of the guard took Jeremiah and said to him, “The LORD your God has spoken this evil against this place.”
And the LORD has brought it and done according as He spoke, because you have sinned against the LORD and have not listened to His voice; therefore this thing has come upon you.

And now, behold, I have loosed you this day from the chains that were upon your hands. If it is good in your eyes to come with me to Babylon, come, and I will set my eye upon you there; but if it is evil in your eyes to come with me to Babylon, refrain. See, all the land is before you; to what is good and right in your eyes to go, there go.

And while he had not yet turned to go back, he said, “Return to Gedaliah son of Ahikam, son of Shaphan, whom the king of Babylon has appointed over the cities of Judah, and dwell with him in the midst of the people; or to whatever is right in your eyes to go, go there.” And the captain of the guard gave him provisions and a gift, and sent him away.
And Jeremiah came to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam at Mizpah, and dwelt with him among the people who were left in the land.

And all the captains of the forces who were in the field, they and their men, heard that the king of Babylon had appointed Gedaliah son of Ahikam over the land, and that he had committed to him men and women and little ones, and from among the poor of the land, of those who had not been carried away captive to Babylon.

And they came to Gedaliah at Mizpah: Ishmael son of Nethaniah, and Johanan and Jonathan the sons of Kareah, and Seraiah son of Tanhumeth, and the sons of Ephai the Netophathite, and Jezaniah son of the Maacathite, they and their men.

And Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, swore to them and to their men, saying, “Do not be afraid to serve the Chaldeans; dwell in the land and serve the king of Babylon, and it shall be well with you.”

As for me, behold, I will dwell in Mizpah, to stand before the Chaldeans who shall come to us; but you, gather wine and summer fruit and oil, and put them in your vessels, and dwell in your cities that you have taken.

Likewise all the Jews who were in Moab, and among the children of Ammon, and in Edom, and who were in all the lands, heard that the king of Babylon had left a remnant for Judah, and that he had set over them Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan.
And all the Jews returned out of all the places where they had been driven, and came to the land of Judah, to Gedaliah at Mizpah, and gathered wine and summer fruit in very great abundance.
Now Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces that were in the field, came to Gedaliah at Mizpah.
and said to him, Do you indeed know that Baalis king of the sons of Ammon has sent Ishmael the son of Nethaniah to strike you down to the soul? But Gedaliah the son of Ahikam did not believe them.

And Johanan son of Kareah spoke to Gedaliah in secret in Mizpah, saying, “Let me go, I pray, and strike down Ishmael son of Nethaniah, and no man shall know it. Why should he strike you dead, and all Judah that are gathered to you be scattered, and the remnant of Judah perish?”
And Gedaliah the son of Ahikam said to Johanan the son of Kareah, “You shall not do this thing, for you speak falsely concerning Ishmael.”

And it came to pass in the seventh month, that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, the son of Elishama, of the royal seed and one of the chief men of the king, came, and ten men with him, to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, to Mizpah; and there they ate bread together in Mizpah.

Then Ishmael the son of Nethaniah arose, and the ten men who were with him, and they struck down Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, with the sword, and he put him to death, whom the king of Babylon had appointed over the land.
And all the Jews who were with him, with Gedaliah at Mizpah, and the Chaldeans who were found there, the men of war, Ishmael struck down.
And it came to pass on the second day after he had slain Gedaliah, and no man knew it,

And men came from Shechem, from Shiloh, and from Samaria, eighty men, with beards shaved and garments torn and gashing themselves, and with grain offering and frankincense in their hand, to bring them to the house of the LORD.
And Ishmael the son of Nethaniah went out from Mizpah to meet them, walking and weeping as he went; and it came to pass, when he met them, that he said to them, Come to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam.
And it came to pass, when they came into the midst of the city, that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah slew them and cast them into the midst of the pit, he and the men who were with him.

But ten men were found among them, and they said to Ishmael, “Do not put us to death, for we have hidden stores in the field, of wheat and barley and oil and honey.” So he desisted, and did not put them to death among their brothers.

Now the pit in which Ishmael had cast all the corpses of the men whom he had struck down by the hand of Gedaliah, that same pit which King Asa had made because of Baasha king of Israel, Ishmael son of Nethaniah filled it with the slain.

And Ishmael took captive all the remnant of the people who were in Mizpah, the daughters of the king and all the people who were left in Mizpah, whom Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had committed to Gedaliah son of Ahikam; and Ishmael son of Nethaniah took them and went to cross over to the sons of Ammon.
And Johanan son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces who were with him, heard of all the evil that Ishmael son of Nethaniah had done.
And they took all the men and went to fight with Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and they found him by the great waters that are in Gibeon.
And it came to pass, when all the people who were with Ishmael saw Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces who were with him, then they rejoiced.
And all the people whom Ishmael had carried away captive from Mizpah turned about and returned, and went to Johanan the son of Kareah.
But Ishmael son of Nethaniah escaped from the presence of Johanan with eight men, and went to the sons of Ammon.

Then Johanan the son of Kareah took, and all the captains of the forces who were with him, all the remnant of the people whom he had brought back from Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, from Mizpah, after he had struck down Gedaliah the son of Ahikam—mighty men of war, and women, and little ones, and eunuchs, whom he had brought back from Gibeon.
And they went and stayed in Geruth Chimham, which is near Bethlehem, to go and to enter into Egypt.
because of the Chaldeans, for they were afraid of them, because Ishmael the son of Nethaniah had struck down Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, whom the king of Babylon had appointed over the land.
Then all the commanders of the forces drew near, and Johanan son of Kareah, and Jezaniah son of Hoshaiah, and all the people from the least even to the greatest.

And they said to Jeremiah the prophet, Let our supplication, we pray you, fall before you, and pray for us to the LORD your God, for all this remnant, for we are left but few of many, as your eyes behold us.
That the LORD your God may declare to us the way in which we should walk, and the thing that we should do.

And Jeremiah the prophet said to them, I have heard; behold, I will pray to the LORD your God according to your words, and it shall be that every word with which the LORD answers you, I will declare to you; I will withhold not a word from you.
And they said to Jeremiah, “May the LORD be a true and faithful witness against us, if we do not do according to every word for which the LORD your God sends you to us.”
Whether it be good or whether it be evil, we will obey the voice of the LORD our God, to whom we are sending you, that it may be well with us when we obey the voice of the LORD our God.
And it came to pass at the end of ten days, that the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah.
And he called to Johanan son of Kareah, and to all the captains of the forces who were with him, and to all the people, from the least even to the greatest.
And he said to them, Thus says the LORD, the God of Israel, to whom you sent me to present your supplication before him:
If you will indeed remain in this land, then I will build you up and not tear you down, and I will plant you and not pluck you up; for I relent concerning the disaster that I have brought upon you.
Do not fear the king of Babylon, before whom you are afraid; do not fear him, declares the LORD, for I am with you to save you and to deliver you from his hand.
And I will grant you mercy, and he will have compassion on you, and will cause you to return to your own land.
But if you say, “We will not dwell in this land,” so as not to obey the voice of the LORD your God,
saying, No, but to the land of Egypt we will go, where we shall not see war, nor hear the sound of the trumpet, nor hunger for bread; and there we will dwell.
And now therefore hear the word of the LORD, O remnant of Judah: Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: If you indeed set your faces to enter into Egypt, and go to sojourn there,
And the sword which you fear shall overtake you there in the land of Egypt, and the famine of which you are anxious shall cling after you there in Egypt, and there you shall die.

And all the men who have set their faces to go down to Egypt to sojourn there shall die by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence, and they shall have no remnant or survivor from the evil that I am bringing upon them.

For thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: As my anger and my wrath were poured out upon the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so shall my wrath be poured out upon you when you go into Egypt; and you shall be an oath, a horror, a curse, and a reproach, and you shall see this place no more.
The LORD has spoken concerning you, O remnant of Judah: Do not go to Egypt. Know for certain that I have testified against you this day.

For you have deceived yourselves in your own souls, for you yourselves sent me to the LORD your God, saying, “Pray for us to the LORD our God, and according to all that the LORD our God shall say, so declare to us, and we will do it.”
And I have declared it to you this day, but you have not listened to the voice of the LORD your God, nor to all for which He sent me to you.
And now, you shall surely know that by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence you shall die in the place where you have desired to go to sojourn there.
And it came to pass, when Jeremiah had finished speaking to all the people all the words of the LORD their God, with which the LORD their God had sent him to them, all these words,

And Azariah the son of Hoshaiah, and Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the proud men spoke, saying to Jeremiah, You speak falsely; the LORD our God has not sent you to say, You shall not go into Egypt to sojourn there.
But Baruch the son of Neriah is inciting you against us, to deliver us into the hand of the Chaldeans, to put us to death and to exile us to Babylon.
But Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces, and all the people, did not listen to the voice of the LORD, to dwell in the land of Judah.
Then Johanan son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces, took all the remnant of Judah who had returned from all the nations where they had been driven, to sojourn in the land of Judah.

The men, and the women, and the little ones, and the daughters of the king, and every soul whom Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had left with Gedaliah son of Ahikam, son of Shaphan, and Jeremiah the prophet, and Baruch son of Neriah.
And they came into the land of Egypt, for they did not listen to the voice of the LORD, and they came as far as Tahpanhes.
And the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah in Tahpanhes, saying,
Take in your hand great stones, and hide them in the mortar in the brickwork which is at the entrance of Pharaoh’s house in Tahpanhes, in the sight of the men of Judah.

And you shall say to them, Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I am sending and will take Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, My servant, and I will set his throne above these stones that I have hidden, and he shall stretch out his royal canopy over them.
He shall come and strike the land of Egypt: whoever is for death, to death; and whoever is for captivity, to captivity; and whoever is for the sword, to the sword.

And I will kindle a fire in the houses of the gods of Egypt, and he shall burn them and carry them away; and he shall wrap the land of Egypt as a shepherd wraps his garment, and he shall go out from there in peace.
And he shall break the pillars of the house of the sun that is in the land of Egypt, and the houses of the gods of Egypt shall he burn with fire.
The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the Jews who were dwelling in the land of Egypt, who were dwelling in Migdol, and in Tahpanhes, and in Noph, and in the land of Pathros, saying:

Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: You yourselves have seen all the evil that I brought upon Jerusalem and upon all the cities of Judah; and behold, they are a desolation this day, and there is no inhabitant in them.
because of their evil which they have done, to provoke Me to anger, in that they went to burn incense and to serve other gods whom they knew not, neither they, nor you, nor your fathers.
And I sent to you all My servants the prophets, rising early and sending, saying, “Oh, do not do this abominable thing that I hate.”
But they did not listen, nor did they incline their ear, to turn back from their evil, so as not to burn incense to other gods.
So my wrath and my anger were poured out and burned in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem, and they became a desolation and a waste, as at this day.

And now thus says the LORD, the God of hosts, the God of Israel: Why are you doing great evil against your own souls, to cut off from you man and woman, child and infant, out of the midst of Judah, so as not to leave yourselves a remnant?

to provoke Me to anger with the works of your hands, burning incense to other gods in the land of Egypt, where you have come to sojourn, that you may be cut off, and that you may become a curse and a reproach among all the nations of the earth.

Have you forgotten the wickedness of your fathers, and the wickedness of the kings of Judah, and the wickedness of their wives, and your own wickedness, and the wickedness of your wives, which they committed in the land of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?
They have not been crushed to this day, nor have they feared, nor have they walked in My law and in My statutes which I set before you and before your fathers.
Therefore thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I set My face against you for evil, and to cut off all Judah.

And I will take the remnant of Judah who have set their faces to go into the land of Egypt to sojourn there, and they shall all be consumed in the land of Egypt; by the sword and by famine they shall be consumed. From the least even to the greatest they shall die by the sword and by famine, and they shall be for an oath, for a horror, and for a curse and for a reproach.
And I will punish those who dwell in the land of Egypt, as I have punished Jerusalem, by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence.

And there shall be no fugitive nor survivor of the remnant of Judah that have come to sojourn there in the land of Egypt, to return to the land of Judah, to which they lift up their souls to return to dwell there; for they shall not return, except a few that escape.

Then all the men who knew that their wives were burning incense to other gods, and all the women who stood by, a great assembly, and all the people who dwelt in the land of Egypt, in Pathros, answered Jeremiah, saying:
The word that you have spoken to us in the name of the LORD, we will not listen to you.

For we will surely perform every word that has gone forth from our mouth, to burn incense to the queen of heaven and to pour out drink offerings to her, as we have done, we and our fathers, our kings and our princes, in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem; and we were filled with bread, and were well, and saw no evil.
But from the time that we ceased to burn incense to the queen of heaven and to pour out drink offerings to her, we have lacked all things, and by the sword and by famine we have come to an end.

And when we burned incense to the queen of heaven and poured out drink offerings to her, was it without our husbands that we made for her sacrificial cakes to worship her and poured out drink offerings to her?
Then Jeremiah said to all the people, to the men and to the women, and to all the people who had given him that answer, saying:

Was it not the incense that you burned in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem, you and your fathers, your kings and your princes and the people of the land—did not the LORD remember them, and did it not come up into His heart?

And the LORD could no longer bear, because of the evil of your deeds and because of the abominations which you have done; and your land became a desolation and a waste and a curse, without inhabitant, as it is this day.

Because you have burned incense and because you have sinned against the LORD, and have not listened to the voice of the LORD, nor walked in his law, nor in his statutes, nor in his testimonies, therefore this evil has come upon you, as at this day.
And Jeremiah said to all the people and to all the women, Hear the word of the LORD, all Judah who are in the land of Egypt.

Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: You and your wives have spoken with your mouths and have fulfilled it with your hands, saying, “We will surely perform our vows that we have vowed, to burn incense to the queen of heaven and to pour out drink offerings to her.” Establish then, you shall surely establish your vows, and perform, you shall surely perform your vows.

Therefore hear the word of the LORD, all Judah who dwell in the land of Egypt: Behold, I have sworn by My great name, says the LORD, that My name shall no more be invoked by the mouth of any man of Judah, saying, “As the Lord GOD lives,” in all the land of Egypt.
Behold, I am watching over them for evil and not for good; and all the men of Judah who are in the land of Egypt shall be consumed by the sword and by famine, until they are brought to an end.

And those who escape the sword shall return from the land of Egypt to the land of Judah, men few in number; and all the remnant of Judah, who came into the land of Egypt to sojourn there, shall know whose word shall stand, mine or theirs.
And this shall be the sign to you, declares the LORD, that I will punish you in this place, that you may know that My words shall surely stand against you for evil.

Thus says the LORD: Behold, I am giving Pharaoh Hophra king of Egypt into the hand of his enemies, and into the hand of those who seek his life, just as I gave Zedekiah king of Judah into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, his enemy, who sought his life.

The word that Jeremiah the prophet spoke to Baruch son of Neriah, when he wrote these words in a scroll from the mouth of Jeremiah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim son of Josiah, king of Judah, saying:
Thus says the LORD, the God of Israel, concerning you, O Baruch.
You said, “Alas now for me, for the LORD has added sorrow to my pain; I am weary with my groaning, and I find no rest.”
Thus you shall say to him, Thus says the LORD: Behold, what I have built I am tearing down, and what I have planted I am uprooting, even this whole land.

And you, do you seek great things for yourself? Do not seek them. For behold, I am bringing evil upon all flesh, declares the LORD, but I will give you your life as spoil in all the places where you go.
The word of the LORD that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the nations.

Concerning Egypt: about the army of Pharaoh Neco king of Egypt, which was by the River Euphrates at Carchemish, which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon struck down in the fourth year of Jehoiakim son of Josiah, king of Judah.
Prepare shield and buckler, and draw near to the battle.
Harness the horses, and mount, O horsemen; stand forth with helmets, polish the spears, put on the coats of mail.
Why have I seen them dismayed, turning back, and their mighty ones shattered and fleeing in flight, and they do not look back? Terror is on every side, declares the LORD.
Let not the swift flee away, and let not the mighty man escape; in the north, by the River Euphrates, they have stumbled and fallen.
Who is this that rises like the Nile, whose waters surge like the rivers?
Egypt rises like the Nile, and like the rivers the waters surge and roar; and he says, I will rise up, I will cover the earth, I will destroy the city and those who dwell in it.
Mount, O horses, and rush madly, O chariots, and let the mighty men go forth: Cush and Put, who grasp the shield, and the Ludim, who grasp and bend the bow.

And that day belongs to the Lord GOD of hosts, a day of vengeance, to avenge Himself on His adversaries; and the sword shall devour and be sated and made drunk with their blood, for the Lord GOD of hosts has a sacrifice in the land of the north by the River Euphrates.
Go up to Gilead and take balm, O virgin daughter of Egypt; in vain you have multiplied remedies, there is no healing for you.
Nations have heard your shame, and your cry has filled the earth; for warrior has stumbled against warrior, together they have fallen, both of them.
The word that the LORD spoke to Jeremiah the prophet, of the coming of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon to strike the land of Egypt.
Declare in Egypt, and make it heard in Migdol; make it heard in Noph and in Tahpanhes. Say, Stand firm and prepare yourself, for the sword has devoured all around you.
Why are your mighty ones swept away? They did not stand, for the LORD thrust them down.
He made many stumble; yes, one fell upon another, and they said, “Arise, and let us return to our own people and to the land of our birth, because of the sword of the oppressor.”
They cried there, “Pharaoh king of Egypt is but a tumult; he has let the appointed time pass by.”
As I live, declares the King, whose name is the LORD of hosts, surely like Tabor among the mountains and like Carmel by the sea, so shall he come.
Make for yourself vessels for exile, O inhabitress, daughter of Egypt, for Noph shall become a desolation and shall be burned, without inhabitant.
Egypt is a very fair heifer; a gadfly from the north has come, it has come.

Her also her hired men in her midst are like stall-fed calves, for they too have turned back, they have fled together, they did not stand, for the day of their calamity has come upon them, the time of their punishment.
Her voice shall go like a serpent, for they shall march with an army, and with axes they shall come against her, like those who hew wood.
They have cut down her forest, declares the LORD, for it cannot be searched out, for they are more than the locusts, and they are without number.
The daughter of Egypt is put to shame; she is delivered into the hand of the people of the north.
The LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: Behold, I will punish Amon of No, and Pharaoh, and Egypt, and her gods, and her kings, even Pharaoh, and those who trust in him.

And I will give them into the hand of those who seek their life, and into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and into the hand of his servants; and afterward it shall be inhabited as in the days of old, declares the LORD.

But you, fear not, my servant Jacob, and be not dismayed, O Israel; for behold, I am saving you from afar, and your seed from the land of their captivity. And Jacob shall return, and shall be at rest and secure, and none shall make him afraid.

You, do not fear, my servant Jacob, declares the LORD, for I am with you. For I will make a full end of all the nations where I have driven you, but of you I will not make a full end. I will chasten you with justice, yet I will by no means leave you unpunished.
The word of the LORD that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the Philistines, before Pharaoh struck Gaza.

Thus says the LORD: Behold, waters are rising out of the north, and shall become an overflowing torrent, and they shall overflow the land and all that fills it, the city and those who dwell in it; and the men shall cry out, and every inhabitant of the land shall wail.

At the noise of the stamping of the hoofs of his mighty ones, at the rattling of his chariots, the rumbling of his wheels, the fathers do not turn to their children, because of the slackness of their hands.

Because of the day that is coming to plunder all the Philistines, to cut off from Tyre and from Sidon every remaining helper; for the LORD is plundering the Philistines, the remnant of the isle of Caphtor.
Baldness has come upon Gaza; Ashkelon is brought to silence, the remnant of their valley. How long will you gash yourself?
Alas, O sword of the LORD, how long will you not be quiet? Withdraw yourself into your sheath; rest, and be still.
How can you be quiet, when the LORD has commanded it? Against Ashkelon and against the seashore, there has He appointed it.
Concerning Moab: Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: Woe to Nebo, for it is laid waste; Kiriathaim is put to shame, it is captured; the stronghold is put to shame and shattered.

No more is the praise of Moab; in Heshbon they have devised evil against her: “Come, and let us cut her off from being a nation.” You also, O Madmen, shall be brought to silence; the sword shall pursue you.
A voice of crying from Horonaim: desolation and great destruction.
Moab is broken; they have caused a cry to be heard among her little ones.
For the ascent of Luhith they go up with weeping; for in the descent of Horonaim the adversaries have heard the cry of destruction.
Flee, escape with your lives, and be like a juniper in the wilderness.
Because you have trusted in your works and in your treasures, you also shall be taken; and Chemosh shall go forth into exile, his priests and his princes together.
And the destroyer shall come upon every city, and no city shall escape; and the valley shall perish, and the plain shall be laid waste, as the LORD has spoken.
Give wings to Moab, for she will surely fly away; and her cities shall become a desolation, without inhabitant in them.
Cursed is he who does the work of the LORD deceitfully, and cursed is he who holds back his sword from blood.

Moab has been at ease from his youth, and he has settled on his lees, and has not been poured from vessel to vessel, nor has he gone into exile; therefore his taste remains in him, and his scent is not changed.
Therefore, behold, days are coming, declares the LORD, when I will send to him tilters who shall tilt him, and they shall empty his vessels and shatter their jars.
And Moab shall be ashamed of Chemosh, as the house of Israel was ashamed of Bethel, their confidence.
How do you say, “We are mighty men, and men of valor for war”?
Moab is laid waste, and her cities have gone up in smoke; and his chosen young men have gone down to the slaughter, declares the King, whose name is the LORD of hosts.
The calamity of Moab is near to come, and his affliction hastens very greatly.
Mourn for him, all you who are around him, and all who know his name; say, “How is the strong staff broken, the rod of splendor!”
Come down from your glory, and sit in thirst, O daughter who dwells in Dibon; for the destroyer of Moab has come up against you, he has ruined your strongholds.
Stand by the way and watch, O inhabitant of Aroer; ask him that flees and her that escapes, say, What has happened?
Moab is put to shame, for it is broken; wail and cry out. Declare it by the Arnon, that Moab is laid waste.
And judgment has come upon the land of the plain, upon Holon, and upon Jahzah, and upon Mephaath.
And upon Dibon, and upon Nebo, and upon Beth-diblathaim.
And upon Kiriathaim, and upon Beth-gamul, and upon Beth-meon.
And upon Kerioth, and upon Bozrah, and upon all the cities of the land of Moab, the far and the near.
The horn of Moab is cut off, and his arm is broken, declares the LORD.
Make him drunk, for he magnified himself against the LORD; and Moab shall wallow in his vomit, and he also shall be in derision.
Was not Israel a laughingstock to you? Was he found among thieves, that whenever you spoke of him, you wagged your head?
Leave the cities and dwell in the rock, O inhabitants of Moab, and be like the dove that makes her nest in the sides of the mouth of the pit.
We have heard of the pride of Moab, exceedingly proud; his loftiness, and his arrogance, and his pride, and the haughtiness of his heart.
I know, declares the LORD, his wrath, that it is not so; his boastings, they have not done so.
Therefore over Moab I wail, and for all Moab I cry out; for the men of Kir-heres I moan.

With the weeping of Jazer I will weep for you, O vine of Sibmah; your shoots passed over the sea, they reached to the sea of Jazer. Upon your summer fruit and upon your vintage the destroyer has fallen.

Joy and gladness are gathered from the fruitful field and from the land of Moab; and I have made the wine to cease from the winepresses. None shall tread with shouting; the shouting shall be no shouting.
From the cry of Heshbon to Elealeh, to Jahaz they have uttered their voice; from Zoar to Horonaim, Eglath-shelishiyah. For even the waters of Nimrim shall become desolations.
And I will cause to cease from Moab, declares the LORD, him who ascends the high place and him who burns incense to his gods.
Therefore my heart for Moab murmurs like flutes, and my heart for the men of Kir-heres murmurs like flutes; therefore the abundance they have made has perished.
For every head is shaven, and every beard is cut off; upon all the hands are gashes, and upon the loins is sackcloth.
On all the housetops of Moab and in its streets, all is lamentation, for I have broken Moab like a vessel in which there is no pleasure, declares the LORD.
How is it broken! How they wail! How Moab has turned the back in shame! And Moab has become a derision and a terror to all who are around him.
For thus says the LORD: Behold, like an eagle he shall swoop down, and shall spread his wings over Moab.
Kerioth is taken, and the strongholds are seized, and the heart of the mighty men of Moab in that day shall be as the heart of a woman in her pangs.
And Moab shall be destroyed from being a people, because he has magnified himself against the LORD.
Terror and pit and snare are upon you, O inhabitant of Moab, declares the LORD.

He who flees from the terror shall fall into the pit, and he who climbs up out of the pit shall be taken in the snare; for I will bring upon her, upon Moab, the year of their visitation, declares the LORD.

In the shadow of Heshbon the fugitives stand without strength, for fire has gone out from Heshbon, and a flame from the midst of Sihon; and it devours the corner of Moab, and the crown of the sons of tumult.
Woe to you, Moab! The people of Chemosh are undone, for your sons are taken into captivity, and your daughters into exile.
Yet will I restore the fortunes of Moab in the latter days, declares the LORD. Thus far is the judgment of Moab.
Concerning the sons of Ammon: Thus says the LORD, Has Israel no sons? Has he no heir? Why then has Malcam taken possession of Gad, and his people dwell in its cities?

Therefore, behold, days are coming, declares the LORD, when I will cause the shout of battle to be heard against Rabbah of the Ammonites; and it shall become a desolate heap, and her daughters shall be burned with fire. Then Israel shall dispossess those who dispossessed him, says the LORD.

Wail, O Heshbon, for Ai is laid waste; cry out, O daughters of Rabbah, gird yourselves with sackcloth, lament and run to and fro by the walls; for their king shall go into exile, his priests and his princes together.
How do you glory in the valleys, your valley flowing, O backsliding daughter, who trusts in her treasures, saying, “Who shall come against me?”

Behold, I am bringing terror upon you, declares the Lord GOD of hosts, from all who are around you; and you shall be driven out, every man straight before him, and there shall be none to gather the wanderer.
And afterward I will restore the fortunes of the children of Ammon, declares the LORD.
Concerning Edom: Thus says the LORD of hosts, Is there no more wisdom in Teman? Has counsel perished from the prudent? Has their wisdom decayed?
Flee, turn back, dwell deep, O inhabitants of Dedan; for the calamity of Esau I bring upon him, the time when I visit him.
If grape-gatherers came to you, would they not leave some gleanings? If thieves came by night, would they not destroy only what was enough for them?
For I have laid Esau bare, I have uncovered his secret places, and he shall not be able to hide himself; his seed is ravaged, and his brothers and his neighbors, and he is no more.
Leave your orphans, I will keep them alive; and let your widows trust in Me.

For thus says the LORD: Behold, those whose judgment was not to drink the cup shall surely drink, and shall you, he who is so, go unpunished? You shall not go unpunished, for drinking you shall drink.
For by Myself I have sworn, declares the LORD, that Bozrah shall become a desolation, a reproach, a waste, and a curse, and all her cities shall be perpetual ruins.
A report I have heard from the LORD, and a messenger is sent among the nations: “Gather yourselves together and come against her, and arise for battle.”
For behold, I have made you small among the nations, despised among men.

Your terror has deceived you, the pride of your heart, O you who dwell in the clefts of the rock, who hold the height of the hill. Though you set your nest on high like the eagle, from there I will bring you down, declares the LORD.
And Edom shall become a desolation; everyone who passes by her shall be appalled and shall hiss at all her wounds.
As in the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah and their neighbors, says the LORD, no man shall dwell there, nor shall a son of man sojourn in it.

Behold, like a lion he comes up from the pride of the Jordan against a secure pasture; for in a moment I will make them run from her, and whoever is chosen I will appoint over her. For who is like Me, and who will summon Me to court, and who is the shepherd who shall stand before Me?

Therefore hear the counsel of the LORD, which He has counseled against Edom, and His thoughts which He has thought against the inhabitants of Teman: Surely the little ones of the flock shall be dragged away; surely He shall lay waste their pasture upon them.
From the sound of their fall the earth quakes; a cry, its sound is heard at the Red Sea.
Behold, like an eagle he shall come up and swoop, and spread his wings over Bozrah; and the heart of the mighty men of Edom in that day shall be as the heart of a woman in her pangs.
Concerning Damascus: Hamath and Arpad are put to shame, for they have heard an evil report; they are melted away. In the sea is anguish; it cannot be quiet.
Damascus has become feeble, she turns to flee, and trembling has seized her; anguish and sorrows have taken hold of her, like a woman in labor.
How is the city of praise not forsaken, the city of my joy?
Therefore her young men shall fall in her streets, and all the men of war shall be silenced in that day, declares the LORD of hosts.
And I will kindle a fire in the wall of Damascus, and it shall devour the palaces of Ben-hadad.
Concerning Kedar and the kingdoms of Hazor, which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon struck down: Thus says the LORD, Rise up, go up against Kedar, and plunder the people of the east.
Their tents and their flocks they shall take; their curtains and all their vessels, and their camels, they shall carry away for themselves, and they shall cry over them, “Terror on every side.”
Flee, wander far away, dwell in deep hiding, O inhabitants of Hazor, declares the LORD; for Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon has taken counsel against you, and has devised a plan against you.
Arise, go up against a nation at ease, that dwells securely, declares the LORD, that has neither gates nor bars; they dwell alone.

Their camels shall be for plunder, and the multitude of their livestock for spoil; and I will scatter them to every wind, those who clip the corners of their hair, and from every side of it I will bring their calamity, declares the LORD.
And Hazor shall become a lair of jackals, a desolation forever; no man shall dwell there, nor shall a son of man sojourn in it.
The word of the LORD that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning Elam at the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, saying:
Thus says the LORD of hosts: Behold, I am breaking the bow of Elam, the chief of their might.
And I will bring upon Elam the four winds from the four quarters of heaven, and I will scatter them toward all those winds, and there shall be no nation where the outcasts of Elam shall not come.

And I will dismay Elam before their enemies and before those who seek their life, and I will bring upon them evil, the burning of my anger, declares the LORD, and I will send after them the sword until I have consumed them.
And I will set My throne in Elam, and will destroy from there king and princes, declares the LORD.
And it shall come to pass in the latter days, that I will restore the fortunes of Elam, declares the LORD.
The word that the LORD spoke concerning Babylon, concerning the land of the Chaldeans, by the hand of Jeremiah the prophet.

Proclaim among the nations and make it heard; lift up a banner, make it heard, do not conceal it. Say, “Babylon is taken, Bel is put to shame, Merodach is shattered; her images are put to shame, her idols are dismayed.”
For a nation has come up against her out of the north; it shall make her land a desolation, and none shall dwell in her, from man even to beast they have fled, they are gone.

In those days and at that time, declares the LORD, the children of Israel shall come, they and the children of Judah together; they shall go on their way weeping, and they shall seek the LORD their God.
They shall ask the way to Zion, their faces set toward it, saying, “Come, and let us join ourselves to the LORD in an everlasting covenant that shall not be forgotten.”
My people have been lost sheep; their shepherds have led them astray, they have turned them away on the mountains; they have gone from mountain to hill, they have forgotten their resting place.

All who found them devoured them, and their adversaries said, “We are not guilty, because they have sinned against the LORD, the habitation of righteousness, even the LORD, the hope of their fathers.”
Flee from the midst of Babylon, and go out from the land of the Chaldeans, and be as he-goats before the flock.

For behold, I am stirring up and bringing against Babylon an assembly of great nations from the land of the north, and they shall array themselves against her; from there she shall be taken. Their arrows are like those of a mighty man who is skilled; none shall return in vain.
And Chaldea shall be for a spoil; all who plunder her shall be satisfied, declares the LORD.

Because you rejoiced, rejoicing indeed, and because you exulted, exulting indeed, you plunderers of My heritage; because you skipped about like a heifer treading out the grain, and neighed like strong steeds.
Your mother is greatly ashamed; she who bore you is confounded. Behold, the least of the nations shall she be, a wilderness, a dry land, and a desert.
Because of the wrath of the LORD she shall not be inhabited, but she shall be wholly desolate; everyone who passes by Babylon shall be appalled and shall hiss at all her wounds.
Set yourselves in array against Babylon round about, all you who bend the bow; shoot at her, spare no arrow, for against the LORD she has sinned.

Raise a war cry against her on every side; she has yielded her hand. Her foundations have fallen, her walls are torn down, for it is the vengeance of the LORD. Take vengeance on her; as she has done, so do to her.

Cut off the sower from Babylon, and him who handles the sickle in the time of harvest; because of the oppressing sword they shall turn each man to his own people, and each man shall flee to his own land.
Israel is a scattered sheep; lions have driven him away. The first who devoured him was the king of Assyria, and this last who has broken his bones is Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon.
Therefore thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I am visiting judgment upon the king of Babylon and upon his land, as I visited upon the king of Assyria.
And I will bring Israel back to his pasture, and he shall feed on Carmel and Bashan, and on the hill country of Ephraim and Gilead his soul shall be satisfied.

In those days and at that time, declares the LORD, the iniquity of Israel shall be sought for, and there shall be none; and the sins of Judah, and they shall not be found. For I will pardon those whom I leave as a remnant.
Against the land of Merathaim go up against her, and against the inhabitants of Pekod; slay and utterly destroy after them, declares the LORD, and do according to all that I have commanded you.
The sound of battle is in the land, and of great destruction.
How the hammer of all the earth is cut down and broken! How Babylon has become a desolation among the nations!
I laid a snare for you, and you were also taken, O Babylon, and you did not know; you were found and also caught, because you contended against the LORD.
The LORD has opened His armory and has brought forth the weapons of His indignation, for this is a work of the Lord GOD of hosts in the land of the Chaldeans.
Come against her from the farthest border; open her storehouses; pile her up like heaps, and utterly destroy her; let there be for her no remnant.
Slay all her young bulls; let them go down to the slaughter. Woe to them, for their day has come, the time of their punishment.
The voice of those who flee and escape from the land of Babylon, to declare in Zion the vengeance of the LORD our God, the vengeance of His temple.

Summon against Babylon archers in multitude, all who bend the bow; encamp against her round about, let there be no escape for her. Repay her according to her work; according to all that she has done, do to her, for she has acted proudly against the LORD, against the Holy One of Israel.
Therefore her young men shall fall in her streets, and all her men of war shall be silenced in that day, declares the LORD.
Behold, I am against you, O pride, declares the Lord GOD of hosts, for your day has come, the time when I will punish you.
And pride shall stumble and fall, and none shall raise him up; and I will kindle a fire in his cities, and it shall devour all that are round about him.
Thus says the LORD of hosts: The children of Israel and the children of Judah are oppressed together, and all who took them captive hold them fast; they refuse to let them go.
Their Redeemer is strong; the LORD of hosts is His name. He shall surely plead their cause, so that He may give rest to the earth, but trouble the inhabitants of Babylon.
A sword is upon the Chaldeans, declares the LORD, and upon the inhabitants of Babylon, and upon her princes, and upon her wise men.
A sword is upon the diviners, and they shall become fools; a sword is upon her mighty men, and they shall be dismayed.
A sword is upon her horses and upon her chariots and upon all the mixed multitude that is in her midst, and they shall become as women; a sword is upon her treasuries, and they shall be plundered.
A sword is against her waters, and they shall be dried up; for it is a land of carved images, and they go mad over their terrors.

Therefore wild creatures of the desert shall dwell there with the jackals, and ostriches shall inhabit it; and it shall no more be inhabited forever, nor shall it be dwelt in from generation to generation.
As when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah and their neighbors, declares the LORD, no man shall dwell there, nor shall a son of man sojourn in it.
Behold, a people comes from the north, and a great nation and many kings shall be stirred up from the uttermost parts of the earth.
They grasp bow and spear; cruel are they and will not show mercy. Their voice roars like the sea, and upon horses they ride, arrayed like a man for battle against you, O daughter of Babylon.
The king of Babylon has heard the report of them, and his hands grow feeble; distress has seized him, anguish like a woman in labor.

Behold, like a lion he shall come up from the pride of the Jordan against a secure pasture; for in a moment I will make them run from her, and whoever is chosen I will appoint over her. For who is like Me, and who will summon Me to court, and who is the shepherd who shall stand before Me?

Therefore hear the counsel of the LORD that He has counseled against Babylon, and His thoughts that He has thought against the land of the Chaldeans: Surely the little ones of the flock shall be dragged away; surely He shall make their pasture a desolation over them.
At the sound of Babylon being taken the earth trembled, and a cry was heard among the nations.
Thus says the LORD: Behold, I am stirring up against Babylon, and against those who dwell in Leb-kamai, a destroying wind.
And I will send to Babylon strangers who shall winnow her, and they shall empty her land; for they shall be against her round about in the day of calamity.
Let not the archer bend his bow, and let him not lift himself up in his coat of mail; and do not spare her young men, utterly destroy all her host.
And the slain shall fall in the land of the Chaldeans, and those thrust through in her streets.
For Israel and Judah have not been forsaken by his God, by the LORD of hosts, though their land is filled with guilt before the Holy One of Israel.
Flee from the midst of Babylon, and each man deliver his soul; do not be cut off in her iniquity, for it is a time of vengeance for the LORD; he is rendering recompense to her.
Babylon was a golden cup in the hand of the LORD, making all the earth drunk; from her wine the nations drank, therefore the nations go mad.
Suddenly Babylon has fallen and is broken; wail over her. Take balm for her pain; perhaps she may be healed.
We would have healed Babylon, but she is not healed. Forsake her, and let us go each to his own land, for her judgment has reached to heaven and is lifted up to the skies.
The LORD has brought forth our righteousness; come, and let us declare in Zion the work of the LORD our God.

Sharpen the arrows, fill the quivers; the LORD has stirred up the spirit of the kings of Media, for his purpose is against Babylon, to destroy it, for it is the vengeance of the LORD, the vengeance of his temple.

Against the walls of Babylon lift up a banner, strengthen the guard, station watchmen, prepare the ambushes; for the LORD has both purposed and also done that which He spoke against the inhabitants of Babylon.
O you who dwell upon many waters, abundant in treasures, your end has come, the measure of your unjust gain.
The LORD of hosts has sworn by Himself: Surely I will fill you with men like locusts, and they shall raise over you a shout of triumph.
He who made the earth by His power, who established the world by His wisdom, and by His understanding stretched out the heavens.

At the sound of His giving there is a tumult of waters in the heavens, and He causes vapors to ascend from the end of the earth; He makes lightnings for the rain, and brings forth the wind from His treasuries.
Every man is brutish without knowledge; every goldsmith is put to shame by his carved image, for his molten image is a lie, and there is no breath in them.
Vanity are they, a work of delusions; in the time of their visitation they shall perish.
Not like these is the portion of Jacob, for He is the Former of all things, and Israel is the tribe of His inheritance; the LORD of hosts is His name.
You are my war club, my weapons of battle; with you I shatter nations, and with you I destroy kingdoms.
And with you I will shatter horse and rider, and with you I will shatter chariot and charioteer.
And I will shatter in you man and woman, and I will shatter in you old man and young, and I will shatter in you young man and virgin.
And with you I will shatter shepherd and his flock, and with you I will shatter farmer and his team, and with you I will shatter governors and officials.
And I will repay to Babylon and to all the inhabitants of Chaldea all their evil that they have done in Zion before your eyes, declares the LORD.

Behold, I am against you, O destroying mountain, declares the LORD, that destroys all the earth; and I will stretch out My hand against you, and roll you down from the rocks, and will make you a burned mountain.
And they shall not take from you a stone for a corner, nor a stone for foundations; for you shall be desolations forever, declares the LORD.

Lift up a banner in the land, blow the trumpet among the nations; consecrate the nations against her, summon against her the kingdoms of Ararat, Minni, and Ashkenaz; appoint a marshal against her, bring up horses like bristling locusts.
Consecrate against her the nations, the kings of Media, its governors and all its rulers, and all the land of his dominion.
The earth trembles and writhes, for the purposes of the LORD against Babylon stand, to make the land of Babylon a desolation, without inhabitant.
The mighty men of Babylon have ceased to fight; they sit in their strongholds. Their strength is dried up; they have become as women. They have set fire to her dwelling places; her bars are broken.
Runner runs to meet runner, and messenger to meet messenger, to tell the king of Babylon that his city is taken from end to end.
The fords have been seized, and the marshes they have burned with fire, and the men of war are terrified.
For thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: The daughter of Babylon is like a threshing floor at the time when it is trodden; yet a little while, and the time of harvest will come for her.

Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon has devoured me, he has crushed me; he has set me as an empty vessel; he has swallowed me up like a dragon, he has filled his belly with my delicacies, he has cast me out.
My violence and my flesh be upon Babylon, shall say the daughter of Zion; and my blood be upon the inhabitants of Chaldea, shall Jerusalem say.
Therefore thus says the LORD: Behold, I will plead your cause and take vengeance for you; and I will dry up her sea and make her fountain desolate.
And Babylon shall become heaps, a dwelling place of jackals, an astonishment and a hissing, without inhabitant.
They shall roar together like young lions, they shall growl like lion cubs.
When they are heated I will set before them their feast, and I will make them drunk, that they may exult, and sleep a perpetual sleep and not awake, declares the LORD.
I will bring them down like lambs to the slaughter, like rams with he-goats.
How Sheshach is taken, and the praise of all the earth is seized! How Babylon has become a desolation among the nations!
The sea has come up over Babylon; with the roar of its waves she is covered.
Her cities have become a desolation, a land of dryness and wilderness, a land where no man dwells, and through which no son of man passes.
And I will punish Bel in Babylon, and I will bring forth out of his mouth that which he has swallowed; and the nations shall stream to him no more. Yea, the wall of Babylon is fallen.
Go out of her midst, my people, and let each man deliver his own soul from the fierce anger of the LORD.

And lest your heart grow faint, and you fear because of the report that is heard in the land; for a report shall come in one year, and after it in another year a report, and violence in the land, and ruler against ruler.
Therefore, behold, days are coming when I will punish the idols of Babylon, and all her land shall be put to shame, and all her slain shall fall in her midst.
And heaven and earth shall sing for joy over Babylon, and all that is in them, for from the north the destroyers shall come upon her, declares the LORD.
Also Babylon must fall for the slain of Israel; and for Babylon have fallen the slain of all the earth.
You who have escaped the sword, go, do not stand still; remember the LORD from afar, and let Jerusalem come up upon your heart.
We are ashamed, for we have heard reproach; disgrace has covered our faces, for strangers have come against the sanctuaries of the house of the LORD.
Therefore, behold, days are coming, declares the LORD, when I will punish her carved images, and throughout all her land the slain shall groan.
Though Babylon should ascend to the heavens, and though she should fortify the height of her stronghold, from Me shall spoilers come upon her, declares the LORD.
A sound of crying from Babylon, and great destruction from the land of the Chaldeans.
For the LORD is laying waste Babylon and destroying from her the great voice; and their waves roar like many waters, the sound of their noise is uttered.
For the destroyer has come upon her, upon Babylon, and her mighty men are taken; their bows are broken in pieces. For the LORD is a God of recompenses; he will surely repay.

And I will make drunk her princes and her wise men, her governors and her deputies and her mighty men; and they shall sleep a perpetual sleep and shall not awake, declares the King, whose name is the LORD of hosts.

Thus says the LORD of hosts: The broad walls of Babylon shall be utterly laid bare, and her high gates shall be burned with fire; so the peoples shall labor for nothing, and the nations for the fire, and they shall be weary.

The word that Jeremiah the prophet commanded Seraiah the son of Neriah, the son of Mahseiah, when he went with Zedekiah king of Judah to Babylon in the fourth year of his reign; and Seraiah was quartermaster.
And Jeremiah wrote in one scroll all the evil that should come upon Babylon, all these words that are written against Babylon.
And Jeremiah said to Seraiah, When you come to Babylon and see it, then you shall read all these words.
And you shall say, O Lord, you have spoken concerning this place, to cut it off, so that there shall not be in it one who dwells, from man even to beast, but it shall be desolations forever.
And it shall be, when you have finished reading this book, you shall bind a stone to it and cast it into the midst of the Euphrates.
And you shall say, Thus shall Babylon sink and shall not rise again because of the evil that I am bringing upon her; and they shall grow weary. Thus far are the words of Jeremiah.
Zedekiah was twenty and one years old when he began to reign, and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem; and his mother’s name was Hamutal, the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.
And he did what was evil in the eyes of the LORD, according to all that Jehoiakim had done.
For because of the anger of the LORD it came to pass against Jerusalem and Judah, until He cast them out from His presence. And Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.

And it came to pass in the ninth year of his reign, in the tenth month, on the tenth day of the month, that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came, he and all his army, against Jerusalem, and they encamped against it, and built a siege wall against it round about.
And the city came under siege until the eleventh year of King Zedekiah.
In the fourth month, on the ninth day of the month, the famine grew strong in the city, and there was no bread for the people of the land.

Then the city was breached, and all the men of war fled and went out from the city by night by way of the gate between the two walls, which is by the king’s garden, while the Chaldeans were against the city round about; and they went by way of the Arabah.
And the army of the Chaldeans pursued after the king, and they overtook Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho, and all his army was scattered from him.
And they seized the king and brought him up to the king of Babylon at Riblah in the land of Hamath, and he spoke judgment upon him.
And the king of Babylon slaughtered the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes; he also slaughtered all the princes of Judah at Riblah.
And he blinded the eyes of Zedekiah, and bound him with bronze fetters, and the king of Babylon brought him to Babylon, and put him in the house of custody until the day of his death.

And in the fifth month, on the tenth of the month, which was the nineteenth year of King Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard, who stood before the king of Babylon, came to Jerusalem.
And he burned the house of the LORD, and the king’s house, and all the houses of Jerusalem, and every great house he burned with fire.
And all the walls of Jerusalem round about were broken down by all the army of the Chaldeans that were with the captain of the guard.

And from the poorest of the people, and the rest of the people who were left in the city, and the deserters who had fallen away to the king of Babylon, and the rest of the multitude, Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried them into exile.
But of the poorest of the land Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard left some, to be vinedressers and plowmen.

And the pillars of bronze that were for the house of the LORD, and the stands, and the bronze sea that was in the house of the LORD, the Chaldeans broke in pieces, and carried all their bronze to Babylon.
And the pots, and the shovels, and the snuffers, and the bowls, and the spoons, and all the vessels of bronze wherewith they ministered, they took away.

And the basins, and the firepans, and the bowls, and the pots, and the lampstands, and the spoons, and the cups—what was of gold, in gold, and what was of silver, in silver—the captain of the guard took.
The two pillars, the one sea, and the twelve bronze oxen that were under the stands, which King Solomon had made for the house of the LORD—there was no weighing of the bronze of all these vessels.
And the pillars, eighteen cubits was the height of the one pillar, and a line of twelve cubits would encircle it, and its thickness was four fingers; it was hollow.

And there was a capital upon it of bronze, and the height of the one capital was five cubits, with latticework and pomegranates upon the capital all around, all of them bronze; and the same was upon the second pillar, with pomegranates.
And the pomegranates were ninety and six on the sides; all the pomegranates were a hundred upon the network round about.
And the captain of the guard took Seraiah the chief priest, and Zephaniah the second priest, and the three keepers of the threshold.

And from the city he took one eunuch who was overseer over the men of war, and seven men of those who saw the king’s face, who were found in the city, and the scribe, the captain of the host, who mustered the people of the land, and sixty men of the people of the land who were found in the midst of the city.
And Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard took them and brought them to the king of Babylon at Riblah.
And the king of Babylon struck them down and put them to death at Riblah in the land of Hamath. So Judah was carried away into exile from off its own soil.
This is the people whom Nebuchadnezzar carried away captive: in the seventh year, of the Jews three thousand and twenty-three.
In the eighteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar, from Jerusalem were taken eight hundred thirty and two persons.

In the three and twentieth year of Nebuchadnezzar, Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive of the Jews seven hundred forty and five persons; all the persons were four thousand and six hundred.

And it came to pass in the thirty-seventh year of the exile of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the twelfth month, on the twenty-fifth day of the month, that Evil-merodach king of Babylon, in the year that he began to reign, lifted up the head of Jehoiachin king of Judah and brought him forth out of the house of confinement.
And he spoke kindly with him, and set his throne above the throne of the kings who were with him in Babylon.
And he changed his prison garments, and he ate bread before him continually all the days of his life.
And his allowance, a continual allowance, was given him from the king of Babylon, the portion of each day in its day, until the day of his death, all the days of his life.
